job_title: Part Time Help Desk Intern - Onsite
fragmented_desc: ['Install, maintain, analyze, troubleshoot, and repair computer systems, hardware, and computer peripherals. Be ready for any technical issue that arises in the…']
full-desc:
BHI (Boulder Heavy Industries) is looking for a IT Helpdesk Intern to join our growing IT team.

BHI is an investment team that incubates advertising, media and e-commerce companies that are disrupting their industries. We provide strategic guidance, and all of the capabilities most startups can’t afford.

You will handle IT support for our end-user technology environment across our internal business units. You’ll have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in Helpdesk Support and possibly cross train in other areas after initial training to meet business needs. This is a great learning opportunity for the current student in Information Technology!

PLEASE NOTE:

This is a Part-Time in-office position located in Boulder, CO. This position requires an equivalent of 3 full business days a week onsite. This is not a role that can be worked remotely. The exact schedule will be determined during the interview process and there is flexibility on our end to accommodate for class schedules. By applying for this role, you are affirming you can meet this requirement.

Also, this is not a summer-only internship. We are looking for someone to start right away and this position may last longer than the summer, depending on the candidate’s availability and desire to continue the working arrangement.

We will be including learning and growth opportunities in the structure and focus of this role, so it will not be just a job, but an opportunity to expand knowledge and experience in the IT field.

A Day in the Life

You will work to troubleshoot and solve every day IT queries via email and in person. Here are some specifics on what your days might look like:

  • Be ready for any technical issue that arises in the Helpdesk queue
  • Install, maintain, analyze, troubleshoot, and repair computer systems, hardware, and computer peripherals.
  • Provide user training on laptop use, printer connections, SaaS applications, and other similar items.
  • Assist with the laptop inventory and management
  • Perform maintenance on existing systems and applications
  • Contribute to current documentation associated with internal infrastructure, systems, and processes
  • Gain hands on experience with different areas of IT and present your journey with the team!

If this sounds like a great learning opportunity to enhance your academic learning, we want to hear from you!

Here's what you need to get our attention

  • In progress of completing a degree in Computer Science or Information Technology

Here's what will make us call you for sure

  • 1-2 years hands-on experience in a Helpdesk or IT troubleshooting role
  • Strong computer skills and the ability to troubleshoot and diagnose problems
  • Familiarity with both Windows operating systems (primarily Windows 11) and MacOS (10.13+)
  • Maintains current knowledge of relevant technology
  • Strong interpersonal skills to help customers fix their issues and feel satisfied with the experience
  • Excellent at documentation
  • Desire to expand skillset

NOT required but will definitely give you an edge!

  • Certifications: CompTIA A+, CompTIA Network +, CompTIA Cloud+
  • Exposure to a scripting language such as Bash or PowerShell
  • Some network experience

Compensation DOE $17.00-18.00/hour

We anticipate this position being open until 3/31/2024. It may be closed earlier or kept open longer depending on the timing of our candidate selection process.

And if we haven't convinced you yet, here is why you'll want to be part of our team:

  • Inspiring, collaborative & SAFE office option in beautiful Boulder, CO where dogs are welcome!
  • Hourly employees receive a PTO accrual based on the number of hours worked.
  • Generous holidays including a reduced schedule between Christmas and New Years

COME AS YOU ARE: your gender, your gods, your sex life, your skin color or your big shot uncle don't make a difference here. BHI LLC is a progressive and open-minded meritocracy. If you're smart and good at what you do, come as you are.

Job Types: Part-time, Internship

Pay: $17.00 - $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 24 – 25 per week

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid time off

Experience level:

  • No experience needed

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

*This is an on-site position located in Shreveport, LA*

Prolec GE designs, manufactures, and sells products and solutions for the generation, transmission, and distribution of electric energy. With more than 50 years’ experience in the industry, Prolec GE is an important player in the Mexican market and a key participant in the rest of the Americas, with business units in Mexico, the United States, and Brazil.

Seeking a customer service oriented individual with good communication skills who is interested in an internship where they will experience a fast-paced IT support environment and gain hands-on experience with Window-based hardware and software.

Roles and Responsibilities

· Install and update software on Window-based computers and other company devices.

· Respond to help desk tickets involving computers, networked printers, network connectivity issues, and other technical issues.

· Verify/update site inventory of all IT assets.

· Perform tech refresh of multiple desktops and laptops, including:

o Installation of company image

o Installation of security software

o Domain registration

o Moving user’s data

o Data wiping of old assets

Required Qualifications

· 1+ years experience

· Enrolled/attending college, seeking degree in IT related field (preferred but not required)

· Strong communication skills

· Able to work with minor supervision

Desired Characteristics

  • Effective communication
  • Customer orientation
  • Passion for results

full-desc:
Summer Intern - Information Technology Department (Candidates must reside in the Roanoke, Va. area)Prosperity Life Roanoke, Virginia, United States (On-site)SaveApply

Prosperity Group Holdings, LP (“Prosperity”) is a holding company with three U.S. insurance entities: Shenandoah Life Insurance Company (“SHEN”), SBLI USA Life Insurance Company, Inc. (“SBLI”), S.USA Life Insurance Company, Inc. (“S.USA”); one Bermuda reinsurance entity, Prosperity Life Assurance Limited (“PLAL”); as well as an asset manager, Prosperity Asset Management, LLC (“PAM”).

Prosperity Life Insurance Group, LLC is seeking a summer intern to join the Information Technology team. This position provides a highly motivated individual with the opportunity to build an exceptional career within the Information Technology / insurance industry. The IT intern position offers knowledge of IT Programming Development and Information Systems, our businesses, and culture. The intern selected will gain experience, skills, support, and exposure needed to help launch their careers in this innovative sector. Interns typically assist with PC Support, Service Desk Support, Remote User Access, and Security Systems. Candidates should have strong oral and written communication skills. Paid internships last 10 – 12 weeks and typically begin in late-May/early-June and end in early/mid-August.

Under limited supervision, this position works with the end user community and IT Programming Development staff to support Information Systems which includes: PC Support, Service Desk support, Remote user Access, and Security Systems.

- Assist with troubleshooting of Prosperity Systems and providing End User Support

- Responds to requests for technical assistance from Prosperity Personnel, which involves answering questions over phone calls or via our ITSM ticketing system; directing inquiries to the appropriate personnel, and diagnosing and/or resolving technical problems.

- Responsible for Service Desk Support, including assisting the Level 1 and Level 2 Support teams. This can include in-office setups, imaging, boxing, shipping, receiving, hardware inventory organization, and office space cleanliness.

- Following up with clients to ensure that all systems are operating without fault.

- Assist with keeping Technical Services storage closets orderly and secure

- Assist in maintaining and updating documentation for the Service Desk

- Inspect and evaluate work done to ensure compliance with quality standards.

- Identify and recommend improvements to the quality and efficiency of our processes

· Current student pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Technology, Information Systems, or other business-related major. Minimum two years of undergraduate degree completed

- If working on an AA, you must be in the middle of the trimester (1 year into a 2-year degree) spell out Associates degree

· Sharp attention to detail

· Strong analytical; organizational and problem-solving skills

· Excited to take on new and challenging assignments

-- Must be able to communicate effectively

- Must be able to lift a minimum of 25 lbs

full-desc:
Join the CloudSolved IT Family!

Are you enthusiastic about tech and looking for an opportunity to kickstart your career in IT? CloudSolved IT is on the hunt for an energetic and motivated professional to join our Cloud Service delivery team. We’re not just any tech company; we’re a vibrant, people-first workspace where your growth, happiness, and well-being are our top priorities.

Why You’ll Love Collaborating with Us:

- Flex Culture: Embrace the freedom to work in the way that suits you best, with flexible arrangements that allow you to balance your personal and professional life.

- Grow As You Go: With retirement benefits and generous PTO/sick policies, we’ve got your back now and in the future.

- Remote & Connected: Dive into a role that’s 25% remote post-training, keeping you engaged with weekly meetups to ensure you’re always part of the crew.

- Health & Wellness: Comprehensive health insurance to keep you in top shape, because we know a healthy team is a happy team.

Your Mission, Should You Choose to Accept:

- Be the hero our clients deserve, tackling service requests with speed and a smile.

- Prioritize and manage daily tickets like a boss, ensuring all our clients feel valued.

- Offer top-notch remote support, guiding our clients through their tech troubles with patience and expertise.

- Be the guardian of client accounts, from smooth onboarding to seamless offboarding.

- Collaborate with vendors to deliver exceptional service experiences.

- Keep our client database as sharp as your tech skills.

What Makes You a Perfect Fit:

- A meticulous, communication maestro with a knack for solving puzzles.

- 1+ year in the Help Desk/Customer Service arena, ready to share your wisdom and learn more.

- Strong written and verbal communication skills

- Tech-savvy, especially with Office 365

- An expert organizer with solid Microsoft Office skills.

- Quick to learn, eager to grow, and always ready for a tech challenge.

- CompTIA A+/Net+ certification or similar credentials will make you shine.

Position Details:

- Starting part-time with the option to go full-time after 180 days.

- Competitive Pay: $19.00 - $24.00 per hour

- Location: Office for duration of training with 1 day option to work from home per week after becoming a full-time employee.

Perks & Benefits:

- 401(k) matching to build your nest egg.

o After 180 days of employment

- Flex schedules for work-life harmony.

o Flexible intern scheduling 15-20 hours a week to start

o Full Time Employment offers work from home 1 day a week guaranteed.

- Premium health insurance because your well-being is a priority.

o 60/40 Healthcare split for Full Time Employees

- Paid time off to recharge and relax.

o 3 sick days

o 3 vacation days

Schedule:

- Monday to Friday, with weekend adventures optional

Experience Desired:

- Customer Service: 1 year customer service (for better or worse!)

- Help desk guru: 1 year (bring those stories!)

- Windows wizardry: 1 year (show us the magic!)

Preferred Licenses/Certifications:

- CompTIA A+ (show us what you’ve got!)

- CompTIA Cloud+ (cloud conquerors, we want you!)

- Bachelor’s Degree (Bonus Points!)

Ready to CloudSolve Your Career? Apply Now!

full-desc:
Software Developer Intern: Summer (May 20th - August 9th, Monday-Friday, 8:30am-5:30pm CT)

About Us

Meritize is an education lender that uses an individual’s academic, military, and work achievements to enhance credit evaluation and expand funding for skills-based education. The Company’s proprietary merit-based lending program goes beyond traditional underwriting to leverage individual academic and experiential data, increasing access to educational funding and improving outcomes. The Meritize platform promotes the growth and development of skills-based careers on behalf of students, educators, and employers through innovative funding solutions, skills-building programs, and career success services.

Key Responsibilities

This is a 12-week, full-time summer internship. This position will be reporting to the Manager, Software Development. The primary responsibilities of the Software Developer Intern include:

  • Design, implement and manage software applications in a variety of object-oriented programming languages/technologies (i.e., Java, Ruby, etc.)
  • Write automated tests at the unit, integration, and end-to-end level with guidance from peers
  • Pair program for 6 hours per day with other developers and actively communicate with Product Managers and Designers in a cross functional team

Key Qualifications

To be eligible for this internship, applicants must have:

  • A college degree or ongoing studies in a related field
  • Be a senior or greater in college (preferred)
  • Strong critical thinking, collaboration, and communication skills

Meritize is an equal-opportunity employer.

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $27.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

  • Work from home

Experience level:

  • Under 1 year

Work Location: Remote

Information Technology Internship

Your school is teaching you computer science…

we’ll teach you how to be an IT professional.

Join a cadre of interns mentored by senior engineers and architects, and have the opportunity to experience the entire IT spectrum. You’ll work on a professional, fun and thoughtful team, collaborate with customers to determine needs, and assist in implementing solid IT practices in a fast-paced environment

You will:

  • Participate, with your mentor, in gathering and analyzing software requirements, designing software features, writing code, and/or testing the software
  • Participate in a hands-on, fun, on-boarding and training schedule to become familiarized with the multiple faces of IT in an organization.
  • Join a cadre of interns who will contribute, participate and make a difference

  • Candidates are interested in a career as an IT professional
  • Enrolled in Bachelors program in Computer Science, cybersecurity, or equivalent
  • At least two years of classes
  • Familiarity with PC hardware or administration

· $15 per hour

Karmak is celebrating 40 years in business and a move to 100% employee ownership – we are going places and invite you to join us! Besides offering competitive insurance coverage and a 401K match, we offer a lifestyle that helps employees put the priority on family and well-being: workplace flexibility (most of our positions are work-from-home), gym, reimbursements, gift card rewards for wellness doctor visits, planet-friendly programs, team activities and our Employee Stock Ownership Plan. We embrace our Midwestern roots in a friendly atmosphere that allows you to succeed. You won’t be a number at Karmak – you’ll be an employee owner whose voice matters. Check us out.

About Us

Meritize is an education lender that uses an individual’s academic, military, and work achievements to enhance credit evaluation and expand funding for skills-based education. The Company’s proprietary merit-based lending program goes beyond traditional underwriting to leverage individual academic and experiential data, increasing access to educational funding and improving outcomes.   • Provide analytical support to varying internal business units as required

  • Ability to work both independently and in a team environment

full-desc:
Job Description

LCLD is seeking a proactive and detail-oriented individual to join our team for the summer (4-6 weeks with a flexible start date). As a Data Administration Intern, you will transfer, transform, and validate our historic data archives into our new database system, Salesforce. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data migration projects, expertise in data manipulation and transformation, and a meticulous attention to detail.

Data Administration Intern

  • Lead the planning and execution of historic data migration projects from legacy systems to a new database platform
  • Design and implement data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes to move data efficiently and accurately
  • ·Collaborate with respective Program Managers to define data migration requirements and timelines

Requirements

  • Basic understanding of database concepts and structures (e.g., SQL, relational databases)
  • Proficient in data cleaning tools and techniques such as Python, R, SQL, etc.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to adapt to new technologies and learn new skills quickly

If you are interested in this position, please reach out to Grace Mitchell (gmitchell@lcld.com).

Job Types: Contract, Temp-to-hire

Pay: $5,000.00 per month

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Richmond, VA 23219

Join our Web Development Internship to kickstart your journey into the world of web development. Gain hands-on experience, work on exciting projects, and learn from industry experts, all while honing your skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and more. Take the leap and pave the way to a rewarding career in web development with us. Apply now!

Responsibilities:

  • Building responsive and visually appealing websites using HTML and CSS.
  • Enhancing user experiences with interactive elements and animations using JavaScript.
  • Mastering modern frontend frameworks like React or Vue.js for dynamic web applications.
  • Implementing best practices in user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) design.
  • Collaborating with design and backend teams to create seamless web solutions.
  • Debugging and troubleshooting frontend code to ensure optimal performance.
  • Using version control systems like Git to manage and track changes in your code.

fragmented_desc: ['Utilize ROS (Robot Operating System) and Linux tools to process collected data into functional virtual maps. Test and improve RUNO’s autonomy on customer sites.']
full-desc:
About us:

Here at ViaBot, we're building a robot made to tackle real-world tasks. We're a hardware startup based in the heart of Silicon Valley and backed by numerous VCs, with a youthful and exceptional team that's ever-growing. Our aim is to change the way people see robots--not as gimmicks or as one-trick ponies, but as sensible solutions to sizable problems. Enter RUNO: an autonomous mobile robot designed to perform outdoor commercial tasks such as sweeping and grass-cutting. Learn more about us at: https://www.viabot.com

Who we're looking for:

ViaBot is searching for a tech-savvy person who is passionate about robotics, looking to employ their creativity alongside industry technology to solve real-world problems. Our ideal candidate is comfortable with Linux and the command line, and carries some off-hand skills like Photoshop/GIMP and familiarity with WASD controls. Also, this candidate won't be afraid to get hands-on with the robot hardware, and get a little dirty in the process. We're looking to hire ASAP, so apply now and you could be working with us in a week!

Responsibilities:

1. Mapping :

  • Pilot our robot RUNO 2.0, equipped with a diverse array of sensors to conduct outdoor property surveys.

2. Data Processing:

  • Utilize ROS (Robot Operating System) and Linux tools to process collected data into functional virtual maps.
  • Transform virtual maps into SVGs (Scalable Vector Graphics) into responsive web visualizations using our data processing tools and procedures, including validation and testing procedures.

3. Validation and Testing:

  • Analyze collected data to identify areas of concern in the generated maps.
  • Validate generated data and artifacts against real world
  • Test and improve RUNO’s autonomy on customer sites

Requirements:

1. Technical Skills:

  • Familiarity with Linux, VMWare, and command-line tools, including SSH and Bash.
  • Basic knowledge of image editing tools such as Photoshop, GIMP, Illustrator, Inkscape.

2. Programming Skills:

  • Basic familiarity with Python.
  • Basic familiarity with C or C++. (Bonus : C++)

3. Physical Abilities:

  • Capable of standing and walking for an average of 3 hours a day, up to 6 hours a day.
  • Able to assist in moving hardware by pushing and pulling.

4. Travel:

  • Ability and willingness to travel as required.

Recommended:

1. Technical Knowledge:

  • Basic understanding of ROS (Robot Operating System).
  • Familiarity with SQL, Node.js, Express

2. Image Editing:

  • Proficiency in Photoshop, GIMP, or similar image editing tools.

3. Graphics Editing:

  • Familiarity with graphics editors like Inkscape

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Night shift
  • On call
  • Travel, as required

What's in it for You:

Join our innovative team and embark on an exciting journey at the forefront of robotics and data technology. As a key player in our operations, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the development and deployment of cutting-edge robotic systems. You will have the opportunity to learn more about deploying an autonomous system from end to end, as well as dive into concepts of mapping, path-planning and obstacle avoidance.

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Evening shift

Application Question(s):

  • Do you have a valid driver's license?
  • Are you legally authorized to work in the United States?
  • Are you comfortable working in an onsite setting?
  • We must fill this position urgently. Can you start immediately?
  • What percent of the time are you willing to travel for this job? (25%? 50%? 75%?)
  • How many years of work experience do you have with Bash?
  • How many years of work experience do you have with Adobe Photoshop?

Work Location: In person

full-desc:
Job Summary

The Help Desk Intern provides prompt and courteous support to our staff on all company supported applications by answering requests/questions concerning equipment, software and hardware. The Help Desk Intern addresses all user inquiries and complaints with the highest degree of professionalism and product knowledge. Position located at our North Ridgeville, Oh facility. April-August.

Essential Functions:

  • Installs new PC equipment and software per company specifications, policies and procedures.
  • Troubleshoots hardware and software issues and makes needed repairs.
  • Assists end users with software training as needed.
  • Develops user documentation for improved user efficiency.
  • Performs maintenance on printers, copiers, fax machines, scanners and RF equipment.
  • Maintains Help Desk application utilizing ticket handling processes.
  • Escalates critical issues through appropriate channels.

Education and Training:

  • High school degree or equivalent required.
  • Actively working on an Associate’s Degree/Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field is preferred.
  • Excellent proficiency with all Microsoft Office applications.
  • SAP experience highly desirable.
  • Strong working knowledge of desktop and laptop functionality.
  • Microsoft certifications desirable.

Skills and Abilities:

  • Strong customer service focus.
  • Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Effectively communicates instructions and technical information in a clear, precise and understandable manner.
  • Ability to maintain a high level of flexibility and to learn and support new applications.
  • Solid comprehension and listening skills.
  • Excellent analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong teamwork skills with the ability to establish and maintain positive and effective working relationships with numerous departments and employees.
  • Strong organizational, project management, multi-tasking and task prioritization skills.
  • Self-motivated and self-directed with the ability to work with little supervision.
  • Careful attention to detail and accuracy.

full-desc:
Title: Junior Programmer - Excel, PowerBI, SharePoint Automation (Part-Time)

Are you a tech-savvy individual with a passion for automation and data management? We are currently seeking a Junior Programmer to join our dynamic team on a part-time basis, requiring 10 hours per week, with flexible scheduling options available (M/T or TH/Fri). If you're eager to learn, have a knack for problem-solving, and enjoy working with data, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.

Responsibilities:

· Collaborate with team members to identify opportunities for automation within Excel, PowerBI, and SharePoint.

· Develop and implement scripts, macros, and workflows to automate repetitive tasks and streamline processes.

· Design and maintain databases to support data analysis and reporting requirements.

· Troubleshoot issues with existing automation solutions and provide timely resolutions.

· Stay updated on emerging technologies and tools to enhance automation capabilities.

Requirements:

· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

· Proficiency in Excel, including advanced formulas, macros, and VBA scripting.

· Familiarity with PowerBI for data visualization and reporting.

· Basic understanding of SharePoint administration and development.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

· Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies.

Preferred Qualifications:

· Experience with other programming languages such as Python, JavaScript, or C#.

· Knowledge of SQL databases and query optimization.

· Previous experience in automation or process improvement projects.

· Certification in Excel, PowerBI, or SharePoint.

Note: This is a part-time position requiring 10 hours per week, with flexibility in scheduling. Hourly pay will be based on experience and qualifications, ranging from $18.92 to $20.89 per hour.

Candidates must confirm the following:

· They have visited the HUBZone Map (sba.gov), entered their address, and received a "Qualified HUBZone" message.

· Acknowledge that this position is for Hubzone candidates only, and a final verification will be done using a DMV License prior to starting the position.

· Understand that all candidates will be asked for a general background check and address verification to verify they are in a Qualified HUBZone .

If you're ready to kick-start your career in programming and automation, apply now and join us in revolutionizing how we work with data! We look forward to welcoming you to our team.

To apply, please send your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and why you're interested in this position to HR@eidos-tek.com.

EIDOS Technologies, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 per week

Experience level:

  • 2 years
  • 3 years

Schedule:

  • Choose your own hours
  • No nights
  • No weekends
  • On call

Work Location: Remote

full-desc:
Landis+Gyr is a leading global provider of integrated energy management solutions. We measure and analyze energy utilization to generate empowering analytics for smart grid and infrastructure management, enabling utilities and consumers to reduce energy consumption. Our innovative and proven portfolio of software, services and intelligent sensor technology is a key driver to decarbonize the grid. Having avoided more than 9 million tons of CO2 in FY 2021 and committed to achieve carbon neutrality by 2030, Landis+Gyr manages energy better – since 1896.
With sales of USD 1.5 billion in FY 2021, Landis+Gyr employs around 6,500 talented people across five continents.


Welcome to Landis+Gyr! We're at the forefront of the energy industry revolution - let's build a brighter energy future together!

Landis+Gyr is seeking an undergraduate Intern for Summer 2024 working on-site Monday through Friday at our Alpharetta, GA office. This is a paid position but we don't offer a housing stipend or relocation assistance so local candidates are preferred.


Project Overview/Job Description
Interesting opportunity for Software Development enthusiasts with an added bonus to get an introduction into the energy domain. The project will involve working on real world software projects, fixing code quality issues by enhancing and adding new unit tests to existing code in a Microsoft Stack environment.

In addition to learning software development and quality fundamentals, the intern will also have an opportunity to learn multiple technologies, including C#, Visual Studio, SQL, Oracle, REST APIs, Kafka, Microservices, MS Azure DevOps, Angular, Java.

To demonstrate the skills learned, the interns will be able to demonstrate quality improvements they implemented using Code Coverage reports, SonarQube reports, and defects fixed using MS Azure DevOps dashboards.


Student Objectives/Responsibilities:
  • Fixing and enhancing code unit tests under guidance of an experienced Senior Software Engineer


  • Working with hardware and testing software.


  • Monitoring the Jenkins builds and analyzing unit tests failures.


  • Analyzing SonarQube reports and creating defects in ADO for fixing issues reported by the tools.


  • Upgrading existing NuGet package tests to .Net Core


  • Updating MS Azure DevOps defects fixed as part of the project.

Qualifications Sought:
  • Interest in Software development


  • Self-motivated to learn new technology. Should be comfortable with C# and .NET.


  • Enthusiastic about online research and problem solving.


Education: An undergraduate student who has completed their Freshman year or higher seeking their Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.


If you have the drive and enthusiasm to accept this challenge and to work in a very dynamic, cross functional and international environment, we are looking forward to meeting you.

Job Title: Intern - Software Development

Requisition ID: 19460
Location: Alpharetta, GA, US
Workplace Type: On-site
Career Level: Intern
Date Posted: Mar 6, 2024


Nearest Major Market: Alpharetta
Nearest Secondary Market: Atlanta

full-desc:
About RF:

ReliabilityFirst Corporation is a regulator focused on the reliability and security of the electric grid. ReliabilityFirst’s mission is to preserve and enhance the reliability, security, and resilience of the Bulk Power System across 13 states and the District of Columbia. ReliabilityFirst is uniquely positioned to work closely with transmission, generation, and other power companies as well as the federal government to help identify and ensure the mitigation of operational risks and physical and cyber security threats to the electric grid.

Purpose of Position:

The IT Specialist will be responsible for supporting our in-house IT department in providing technical assistance, maintaining both cloud and on-prem systems, strengthening our cybersecurity posture, and helping to implement and train staff on new technologies. It is also desirable for this position to be able to research and present to the IT team information regarding IT best practices and improvements to our existing processes and systems.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Work directly with staff and customers on software-related issues to minimize delays
2. Under IT staff guidance, install, configure, and troubleshoot computer systems, both hardware and software
3. Monitor our technology stack for issues and analyze our security reports for threats
4. Break down data from multiple sources and provide trends and areas of improvement to the IT Department
5. Work with all staff to share in technology training
6. Participate in multiple IT projects and commitments
7. Participate in performance process and applying feedback
8. Willing to travel up to (10%)

Qualifications:

1. Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree or Technical degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field.
2. Computer skills: Experience or Knowledge in system security, networking, servers, and cloud-based SaaS.

Desirable:

1. Knowledge of computer systems and software
2. Knowledge of networking
3. Familiarity with foundational networking
4. Desire to learn further cloud-based cybersecurity
5. Willing to train and troubleshoot end-users
6. Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
7. Strong communication and customer service skills
8. Able to work independently and as part of a team

ReliabilityFirst is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees and applicants in accordance with local and federal laws. ReliabilityFirst's mission is to preserve and enhance bulk power system reliability and security. This mission cannot be accomplished without a diverse and inclusive staff - one that at all levels feels empowered, valued, respected, and engaged.

Learn more at: Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at RF (rfirst.org)

Job Type: Internship

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Ability to Relocate:

  • Independence, OH 44131: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Independence, OH 44131

fragmented_desc: ['Overview of tools and programming languages to be used. Objective: Identify and develop a set of insightful queries. This will be a paid summer internship.']
full-desc:
Material Bank is a fast-paced, high-growth technology company and created the world's largest material marketplace for the Architecture and Design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to start and manage a design project. Learn more about us at www.materialbank.com or see below.

Material Bank is looking for 3 Software Engineering Interns to join the team for a summer Internship. This will be a 6 week internship where you be able to get hands on experience as well as see a project go from development to launch. You will get to work along side our Principal Engineers where they will teach you the best practices and elevate your skills for both coding and UI. This will be a paid summer internship.

Project Overview

The core objective of this summer intern project is to enhance the utility and accessibility of a graph database containing approximately 20 nodes and 20 relationships (and the subsequent infinite permutations). The project is divided into three main components:

  • Development of Insightful Queries: Interns will explore the graph database to create a set of queries that can extract meaningful insights, which could include identifying key influencers within the network, understanding connection patterns, or uncovering hidden relationships.
  • User Interface (UI) Development: The aim is to build an intuitive and user-friendly interface that allows Members and Brands to interact with the database effortlessly, run queries, and visualize the results in a comprehensible manner.
  • API Expansion and Integration: This involves expanding the existing set of APIs and ensuring they are robust enough for integration with other services, allowing for the seamless exchange of data and insights extracted from the graph database.

Week-by-Week Breakdown

Week 1: Orientation and Planning

  • Objective: Get familiar with the project, tools, and technologies involved. Plan the project timeline and deliverables.
    • Activities:
    • Introduction to the graph database and its current capabilities.
    • Overview of tools and programming languages to be used.
    • Initial brainstorming sessions to identify potential insightful queries and UI/UX design preferences.
    • Setting up development environments.

Week 2-3: Development of Insightful Queries

  • Objective: Identify and develop a set of insightful queries.
    • Activities:
    • Data exploration to understand the structure and key characteristics of the graph.
    • Designing and testing queries to extract meaningful insights.
    • Documentation of the queries and insights they are expected to provide.

Week 4-5: UI Development for Customer Use

  • Objective: Develop a user-friendly interface for interacting with the graph database.
    • Activities:
    • Sketching wireframes and designing UI layouts.
    • Implementing the front-end interface that connects with the backend queries.
    • User testing and UI adjustments based on feedback.

Week 6: API Expansion and Documentation

  • Objective: Expand the API suite and ensure proper documentation for external use.
    • Activities:
    • Identifying additional functionalities required by external services.
    • Developing and integrating new APIs.
    • Creating comprehensive documentation and examples for using the APIs.

Deliverables

  • A set of insightful queries along with documentation.
  • A fully functional UI for customers to interact with the graph database.
  • An expanded set of low latency APIs with thorough documentation for external integration.

Skills and Technologies

Interns will gain exposure to a variety of skills and technologies, including but not limited to:

  • Graph databases (e.g., Neo4j, Amazon Neptune)
  • Programming languages (e.g., Python for backend, JavaScript frameworks like React or Vue.js for frontend)
  • API development (e.g., RESTful APIs, GraphQL)
  • Version control systems (e.g., Git)
  • UI/UX design principles

What is Needed:

  • Looking for 3 summer interns to join us for a 6 week project
  • We are looking 2 interns with with basic knowledge of python
    • Exposure with python or data manipulation
    • Will be able to teach them infrastructure side
    • Internal product
    • Insights with internal customers
  • 1 intern with basic UI
    • Something like Plotly + Dash (ie https://dash.gallery/)
    • Or React frontend with Highcharts js (great js charting lib)

Evaluation and Feedback

Regular check-ins and feedback sessions will be scheduled to ensure the project is on track and interns have the opportunity to learn and adjust their approaches as needed.

This project outline provides a comprehensive framework for interns to contribute meaningfully to the development and enhancement of a graph database system, ensuring a valuable learning experience while delivering tangible outcomes.


About Material Bank

Material Bank is the world's largest material marketplace for the architecture and design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to search and sample materials. Material Bank connects design professionals to hundreds of manufacturers through facilitating brand discovery, rep engagement, and material sampling.

Material Bank has transformed the way an entire industry discovers and samples materials. By removing the friction that exists in the process, we drive business between architects and designers (members) and our Brand Partners (clients).

Our powerful material database and proprietary robotic distribution facility allow members to order samples until midnight (ET) to be delivered free of charge anywhere in the US, in one box, by 10:30 AM the next morning.

Connect with us and discover your career at Material Bank.

-
Material Bank is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or other status protected under any applicable federal, state or local law.

full-desc:
Astronics AeroSat Corporation recently relocated to Manchester, New Hampshire doubling the size of our building in order to support our projected growth. We design and manufacture tail-mounted and fuselage-mounted aircraft SATCOM systems to provide inflight internet and live TV connectivity for commercial and business aviation, VVIP, and military aircraft around the world.

Astronics AeroSat Corporation is seeking for a Software Engineer Internship to support a diverse range of projects and responsibilities.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Performing software module and system level testing.
  • Running acceptance test protocols for the purpose of:
  • Identifying areas where operator feedback can be improved.
  • Reviewing the generated test reports.
  • Review Python based acceptance test protocols for the purpose of:
  • Adding commenting to the code that outline main purpose of modules and functions.
  • Identifying main data structures.
  • Mapping the modules dependencies.
  • Identifying areas where coupling can be reduced.
  • Gaining exposure to real world multi module applications .
  • Generate pseudocode code for system performance testing.
  • Attend code reviews.
  • Maintain ace of the System Integration Lab.

full-desc:
Montage Medical Group is looking to provide an internship opportunity to a Monterey County or Santa Cruz County local student who is interested on a Data Analysis career.

Montage Medical Group’s internship provides a recent graduate with an opportunity for hands-on data analytics experience in healthcare. Under the direct supervision of the Director of Clinical Analytics, the Data Analytics Intern, will use their skills to advance the quality, service and affordability goals of Montage Medical Group and learn from experienced professionals. This is a 6 month, full time, paid internship with the potential of hiring on.

The intern will support routine and ad hoc data extraction and analysis, report generation, quality assurance and automation of data processes. The intern will also be responsible for a project that best suits both the business needs of Montage Medical Group and their skillset. The project will work through the steps of the data analytics lifecycle, culminating in a final summary at the end of the internship period.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret tends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Assist Director of Clinic Analytics with various projects
  • Query home-grown and vendor databases for ad hoc data and reporting needs
  • Provide operational, clinical and strategic level reporting and analytics from various databases and applications
  • Operate existing routine data flows while maintaining and expanding automation tools as needed
  • Visualize data using tools such as Tableau, Excel and Python
  • Implement a project through the data analytics lifecycle
  • Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Experience with SQL and/or programming (demonstrated by coursework or personal projects)
  • Analytic skills and interest in statistics, data science, data engineering and related technical disciplines
  • Proficient organizational, written, verbal and presentation skills
  • Interest in healthcare
  • Excellent critical thinking/problem solving skills
  • Strong attention to detail

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in a technical subject or relevant experience with databases, coding or software development.

full-desc:
Best Egg is the leading financial confidence platform that provides flexible solutions to real-life challenges for people with limited savings. We leverage real-time customer insights and data science to connect more people with the right products for their financial needs. Our offers include a growing suite of products such as personal loans, a credit card, and flexible rent, which are complemented by a suite of financial health tools to help customers make smart financial decisions and stay on track, so they can be money confident no matter what life throws at them.
Our culture and values inspire our employees and customers to embrace Best Egg. We are committed to championing a culture of inclusiveness and diversity of thought, and we focus on providing a safe, flexible, and collaborative work environment. Our employees are encouraged to engage in creative problem solving, and we promote opportunities for growth and enrichment across the organization.
If you are inspired by inspiring others, Best Egg is the place for you.

Best Egg promotes diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better we will grow.

Best Egg is seeking a Software Engineering Co-op who is eager to contribute to a cross-functional agile team and help develop internal and customer-facing software. You can expect to enjoy a culture embracing the concepts of continuous delivery, total quality management, knowledge sharing, personal and career advancement, empowerment, innovation, and collective ownership.

This role will report to the Technology - Software Engineering & Architecture Department

You will spend most of your time doing:

    • Actively contribute to code.
    • Work closely with the Engineer Lead and members of the backend team.
    • Participate in the Agile development cycle.

Ideal fit for this role:

    • Comfort with at least one of: Python, Java.
    • Understanding of the principles of object-oriented programming.
    • Experience with SQL database fundamentals.
    • Creative problem-solving skills.
    • Ability to interact and collaborate productively with technical and non-technical colleagues.
    • Demonstrated record of independence and perseverance.
    • Effective and proactive communication skills with peers and managers.
    • Curiosity and a readiness to learn new skills, strategies, and technologies.
    • Computer science, computer engineering, and related fields, for individuals possessing the desired technical skills.
$20 - $24 an hour

Our Brand:
At Best Egg, we believe money should be accessible so people can reach their goals, live a fuller life, and feel pride in knowing they have taken control of their finances. For those who need extra money to achieve the progress they seek in life, Best Egg is the modern solution-minded finance provider that mixes decades of banking experience with smart technology and deep customer insight to create products designed for today’s borrower, so that people can establish a smoother financial path. The egg symbolizes protection and a fresh start.

Employee Benefits
Best Egg offers many additional benefits for our employees, including (but not limited to):
  • Pre-tax and post-tax retirement savings plans with a competitive company matching
program
  • Generous paid time-off plans including vacation, personal/sick time, paid short-
term and long-term disability leaves, paid parental leave, and paid company
holidays
  • Multiple health care plans to choose from, including dental and vision options
  • Flexible Spending Plans for Health Care, Dependent Care, and Health
Reimbursement Accounts
  • Company-paid benefits such as life insurance, wellness platforms, employee
assistance programs, and Health Advocate programs
  • Other great discounted benefits include identity theft protection, pet insurance,
fitness center reimbursements, and many more!

In compliance with the CCPA, Best Egg is fully committed to handling the personal information and data of employees and job applications responsibly with respect and due care.

Intern – Software Development

UNITE HERE seeks two (2) Software Developer Interns to be a part of the Union’s technology team supporting campaigns. Our technology teams based in the New York metropolitan area and across the country are dedicated professionals with a strong commitment to our mission. If you are a creative problem-solver looking to help build and support the next generation of labor union technology and try new things in a fast-moving organization, you will love working with us.

UNITE HERE is a progressive, member-driven, not-for-profit union, dedicated to organizing workers in the hotel/hospitality, gaming/casino, and food service (including at airports and cafeterias) industries to lift workplace standards across the United States and Canada. You will be part of a team that empowers workers—primarily women, people of color and immigrants—in low-wage service sector jobs to achieve better wages, benefits, dignity, and rights at work.

Position Summary: We are entering our second year building our foundational team, transitioning to an in-house team rather than relying heavily on 3rd parties for software development. The Software Developer Internship is a 9-week role for a rising college senior, recent graduate, or equivalent, who is flexible and eager to learn and grow. The Intern will be supported on a few projects by a Software Developer to make important contributions to software to drive campaigns. The Intern will also have direct campaign interaction as well.

Job Responsibilities:

In the support, maintenance, and new development of software:

· Develop new features, enhance existing features, upgrade packages, improve supportability, and fix or troubleshoot on UNITE HERE’s software suite.

· Collaborate with team members and clients to support required applications.

· Create and implement design plans.

· Communicate development plans, progress, and risks.

Job Requirements/Qualifications:

· Motivation to work for economic and social justice.

· Significant progress toward a degree in information technology or computer science, or equivalent experience

· Experience with one or more of: Angular, Python, .NET, PHP.

· Ability to travel for core Union activities.

· Hybrid work arrangements can be accommodated.

Full application MUST include cover letter for applicant to be considered. Please be sure to describe your motivation to work for an organization that fights for economic and social justice.

full-desc:
Who are you?

Simply put, you're a highly analytical thinker who's passionate about travel and supporting local businesses. You love discovering new places, and you're excited to join our mission of supporting businesses globally through the power of sharing. You're a bit of a food and drink aficionado, and you're ready to make an impact on a global scale by helping to support our Data Science Org. Sound like you? Then read on, friend, and let's get to it!

About the Role:

Atmosfy is seeking a highly Data Science intern to work directly with the Data Science and Product Analytics team. This position will work closely with Growth Leads and Product Leads to analyze and optimize the user experience.

Compensation:

$40 - $50 per hour

Responsibilities:

What you'll be doing?

  • As an intern, you will be expected to be hands-on and routinely exercise independent judgment in delivering new Data Science/Machine Learning insights
  • Work closely with product management to understand product vision and user engagement strategy
  • Work with Software Engineers to deliver on the Data Science Roadmap in a fast-paced environment
  • Balance the business needs with technical constraints by building deep subject matter expertise for your area
  • Maintain the team's focus on strategy and goal-oriented results when tackling complex problems
  • Provide regular updates about program progress, issues, and risks to key stakeholders
  • Comfortable with hands-on, day-to-day problem solving, implementing quick and effective action plans to meet short-term priorities and emerging opportunities

Qualifications:

What we're looking for?

  • Passion for data science and delivering data-driven outcomes
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Understanding of Machine Learning concepts and tools
  • Hands-on technical skills with the inquisitiveness to learn products, work with them, and provide recommendations to drive continuous improvement
  • Able to work independently yet collaborate cross-functionally in a global and multicultural environment
  • Comfortable and effective working in new areas that require experimentation and rapid problem-solving
  • Knowledge of the Atmosfy Brand

About Company


We are Atmosfy App, Inc. We're the fastest-growing platform globally for live video of dining, nightlife, & travel. We help support local businesses globally by enabling creators to share their experiences.


We help people in over 150 countries and 10K+ cities discover the world's best experiences through video. Exciting a global audience with mouth-watering videos of maple syrup dripping off chicken & waffles, FOMO-inducing nightclubs, or skydiving in Rio is hard work.


That's why we employ the industry's most creative, passionate people. Help us revolutionize how people discover experiences. Our team draws on talented people who have worked at best-in-class tech and entertainment companies.


Check us out on atmosfy.io to learn about our mission to share experiences, inspire others, and support local. Also, check out https://atmosfybiz.io/lodging to learn more about our hotel offerings.

full-desc:
SUMMARY OF COMPANY

BioUrja Advisors is the shared services company within BioUrja Group. Established in 2006, BioUrja was initially founded to supply physical bioethanol to the U.S. refining industry, BioUrja has since evolved into a leading supplier of refined petroleum products and natural gas liquids, in addition to maintaining its strong presence in the bioethanol supply and trading sector. We count every major refining company as our customer, as well as most of the largest international trading houses and wholesalers. We are renowned globally in the energy industry, with a reputation for exceptional service and reliability in delivering physical commodities anywhere.

JOB DESCRIPTION

BioUrja Group is looking for a talented and motivated student enrolled in an information technology undergraduate program to join us onsite for 10-12 weeks in Summer 2024 at BioUrja’s global headquarters location in Houston, TX. In this role, you will have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience and exposure to various aspects of corporate IT support, cybersecurity, business analysist, and infrastructure. Under the guidance of our experienced legal professionals, you will work closely with supporting the day-to-day technology needs of the business.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • IT Research: Conduct comprehensive technology research on new or existing platforms and potential improvements such as infrastructure, security related documentation and improvements, potential uses for AI or machine learning within our environments, etc.
  • Administrative Tasks: Assist in reviewing existing IT policies, procedures, and updating as necessary including data flows and user application inventory and functionality analysis. Perform equipment organization, inventory of systems, and misc. other physical review processes.
  • Project Assistance: Contribute to special projects and initiatives undertaken by the IT team, such as mergers and acquisitions.
  • Support: Day to day IT support including patching of loaner workstations, upgrading workstations applications and operating systems, network labeling, installation of software as required.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Currently enrolled in an Information Technology related program or undergraduate program.
  • Strong academic performance with a minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0 scale.
  • Excellent research, analytical, and critical thinking skills.
  • Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in work output.
  • Effective communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Ability to prioritize tasks, manage time efficiently, and meet deadlines.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Must be able to work in-person at Houston, TX 77042 headquarters.

DURATION AND COMPENSATION

  • 8–12-week commitment, 40 hours per week full time
  • Compensation package will be competitive and commensurate with experience.

Job Type: Internship

Compensation package:

  • Hourly pay

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

  • Houston, TX 77042: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

PureCode has recently secured $3 million USD in funding from a Silicon Valley venture capitalist, setting the stage for significant growth and innovation. About The Company

Panoptyc (https://panoptyc.com/) AI and manual review to detect theft at over 15,000 markets in the US. We serve Fortune 500 companies and SMBs alike and are on track to serve 200,000 locations by the end of this year.

Panoptyc is a fully remote team that has grown rapidly for the last 3 years, and is looking to expand our team with top talent from around the world.

What We're Looking For

You’re an undergraduate or graduate student who enjoys tinkering with hardware and software. You enjoy writing code, breaking things, fixing things, and have a knack for technical problem solving. You’re a self-starter and able to succeed both autonomously and as part of a team. You’re a quick learner, and intellectually curious. This position offers a unique opportunity to work closely with experienced engineers and product developers, gaining hands-on experience in a fast-paced, tech-driven environment. This internship is an excellent opportunity for those looking to make a significant impact in the world of technology and security.

  • Pursuing a degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.

  • Possess a strong foundation in programming, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

  • Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts is a plus.

Tasks And Responsibilities

  • Assisting in the design and implementation of software, conducting tests and analyzing data to enhance system performance.

  • Participating in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues.

  • Current undergraduate or graduate student pursuing a degree in computer science, electrical and computer engineering, or a related field

Compensation

Benefits

fragmented_desc: ['Pursuing a career in a creative services field such as design, advertising, marketing, or communications. Participate in the Summer Intern Project, leading on…']
full-desc:
SARANKCO is seeking three full-time paid interns for our creative team who will participate in various stages of digital, print, and copywriting projects from concept through execution. These interns should be prepared to work in a fastpaced, high-performance, collaborative team environment, and will finish the internship having gained broad experience across several industries and communications channels.

The SARANKCO Student Internship Program offers opportunities to learn from and interact with the following departments of our studio: Digital and Print Design, Copywriting, Strategy, Production, Project Management, Operations, and Senior Leadership. Mentors will work closely with our interns to ensure a successful and valuable internship experience that will include exposure to typical client work as well as special projects and assignments.

ABOUT THIS OPPORTUNITY

SARANKCO Creative Studio is searching for a talented and passionate Design Intern with an outstanding portfolio of work that spans print design, branding, packaging, digital design, motion graphics, and social. We are looking for someone who is detail-oriented, self-motivated, has great communication skills, and is eager to learn. This role will frequently collaborate with other designers, copywriters, strategists, developers, project managers, and senior team leaders. A solid design foundation and understanding of digital and print practices is required, along with a can-do attitude and curious spirit. The Design Intern will spend most of the summer partnering with the other interns while working on a curated group project, but will also be given ample opportunity to assist and possibly lead on client projects as well. At the end of the summer, the Design Intern should expect to complete this program with some impressive portfolio pieces, and three months of professional experience in a fast-paced agency environment.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Currently pursuing or recently completed a BFA, MFA, or similar in design-related discipline
  • Undergraduate students should be a rising Junior or Senior
  • Pursuing a career in a creative services field such as design, advertising, marketing, or communications
  • Working knowledge of Sketch, InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, Dreamweaver, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PowerPoint and Keynote
  • Familiarity with Figma, WordPress, and other design software is a plus
  • Knowledge of UI/UX, web design, and social media techniques and trends
  • Educated in branding and visual identity, with strong typography, color theory, and composition foundation
  • Basic knowledge of print design and production methods – creating specifications for paper stock, inks and varnishes, folding structures, plastics, etc
  • Excellent communicator, able to persuasively present ideas and discuss their strategic design approach
  • Shares and receives direction well and demonstrates excellent time-management skills
  • Self-motivated and ambitious, hungry for opportunities, and passionate about design
  • Located in NYC during the summer months, and available to work both in-person and remote as needed

ROLE + RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Participate in the Summer Intern Project, leading on the design-related aspects of the project, and collaborating with the other interns to complete the assignment before the end of the summer
  • Support the efforts of the creative team to collaboratively execute innovative projects through solid brand strategy across all clients and verticals
  • Assist on the design and development of identity programs, email marketing campaigns, web pages, mobile applications, print collateral, and packaging for premium brands and services
  • Help to prepare perfectly-crafted creative materials and presentation decks that align with client objectives, and studio best practices
  • Present design work and ideas thoughtfully and persuasively, both internally to project teams and externally to our clients
  • Participate in all team meetings and brainstorming sessions, actively contributing to the conversation

COMPENSATION + BENEFITS

This is a full-time, paid internship that will work partially in-person at our NYC studio for a duration of 10–12 weeks over the summer between May and August 2024, at a compensation rate of $18/hour. SARANKCO will provide lunch on in-studio days, and offers a full kitchen of complimentary coffee, tea, beverages, and snacks. We provide our interns with robust training and development that includes an introduction to our company and clients, process and tools training, and mentorship with senior team members.

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

  • New York, NY 10010: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10010

full-desc:
Internship in ERAS software development team will have opportunity to explore:

1) Software development life cycle (SDLC)
2) Agile methodology which is project management and software development approach that breaks projects down into phases and emphasizes flexibility, collaboration, and customer-centered. It is an iterative methodology that adapts to changing requirements and delivery software with faster and fewer changes
3) communication and team-work skills in software development world

An Intern, the object is that he/or she will learn and becoming proficient in software at entry level through this internship opportunity.
Description:
We are the ERAS software development team under the AAMC IT organization.
We support medical graduates pursuing residency careers.
Electronic Residency Application Service (ERAS) is the centralized online application service through which the M.D. and D.O. graduates of medical schools apply to residency and fellowship programs in the US. ERAS delivers the application, along with supporting documents, to residency and fellowship programs.
Development Opportunities:
The intern will be engaged with the ERAS development team in daily scrum meetings and technical discuss about software enhancement or bug fixes. Understanding the SDLC and Agile process.
By completing internships, students can sharpen professional skills, develop career interests and employer contacts, assess strengths, and connect classroom theories to practical, real-world settings.
Job Duties:
  • Participate in daily scrum meetings to understand the Agile process
  • Review the business requirement and updating existing applications functionality based on user requirements
  • Communicate with clients and other team members about project status and issues that arise
  • Review documentation about new technology releases or product updates to ensure an understanding of how the system/ or enhancement works
  • Research new technologies and techniques to identify opportunities for improvement
Qualifications:
1) Knowledge of the software development life cycle (SDLC)
2) Experienced with software development tools such as Github, Jira software so on
3) Coding skills such as Java, Angular, and Oracle database knowledge is preferred
4) Good communication and team player
Degree or education level:
A college student who pursues in Computer Science field with coding skills is preferred

Remote Work Eligibility
This position may be eligible for remote work.
Compensation Grade Range and Mid-Point
Grade Range:$18.00 - $26.00/ Grade Mid-Point:$22.00
The above annual compensation range and mid-point are general guidelines. For candidates who meet the criteria, the AAMC's compensation philosophy is to target the midpoint of the salary range. Multiple factors are taken into consideration to arrive at the final hourly rate/annual salary to be offered to the selected candidate. Factors include, but are not limited to, the scope and responsibilities of the role, the selected candidate’s work experience, education and training, as well as internal equity, market, and business considerations.
If a bachelor’s degree is required, related work experience may be substituted in some positions. One year of college course work at an accredited institution is equivalent to one year of related work experience.
The Association of American Medical Colleges (AAMC) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. The AAMC is committed to the policy of an equal employment opportunity in recruitment, hiring, career advancement, and all other personnel practices. The AAMC will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, national origin, religion, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibilities, matriculation, political affiliation, genetic information, disability, past or current military service, or any other legally protected characteristic.

job_title: Internship, Fullstack Software Engineer, Maps & Autopilot Navigation (Fall 2024)
fragmented_desc: ['Flexibility is paramount, as the engineer must learn a wide array of technologies to improve customer experience ranging from route quality and ETA prediction…']
full-desc:
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
What to Expect
Consider before applying: This position is expected to start around Aug/Sep and continue through Dec/Jan. Internships are in-person for 40 hours a week for a minimum of 12 weeks. Please consider before submitting an application.
International Students: If your work authorization is through CPT, please consult your school before applying. You must be able to work 40 hours per week. Many students will be limited to part-time depending on their academic standing.
Internship Programs at Tesla

The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year-round program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by giving them ownership over projects that are critical to their team’s success.
Locations: Palo Alto, CA
About the Team
Tesla is a leader in Autopilot technology and we’re building the world's best in-car navigation experience. These two fields overlap in the role of Maps Engineer. We're looking for motivated software engineers that are up to the challenge.
You will implement next generation algorithms on top of large amounts of data from the Tesla fleet. This is a cornerstone on which Navigate on Autopilot and Smart Summon are implemented. In addition, the same data will drive more efficient routing and better turn-by-turn navigation for customers.
The ideal candidate is self-driven, has experience developing high-performance applications and motivated by complex algorithmic problems. Our engineers must bring a principled, data-driven methodology to software development with a passion for improving quality of their products. Flexibility is paramount, as the engineer must learn a wide array of technologies to improve customer experience ranging from route quality and ETA prediction all the way to self-driving capabilities.
What You’ll Do
  • Rapidly prototype in-car customer experiences
  • Build full stack features for both in-car maps and Autopilot navigation
  • Extract meaningful data from fleet telemetry via automated processes
  • Implement complete features with both client and server footprint
  • Design, code, and debug software on Linux-based embedded platforms and Linux servers
  • Work with a cross-functional team of hardware engineers, application/UI software engineers, QA/Validation, and designers
What You’ll Bring
  • Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related field with a gradation date between 2024 - 2025
  • Proficient in one of C++, Python, Go, Scala
  • Experience writing and shipping customer-facing code
  • High standards for code quality, maintainability, and performance
  • Willingness to learn new technologies in any area of the stack: Vehicle Control, Routing/Guidance Algorithms, Server Infrastructure, UI, Embedded Systems
  • Nice to have: Experience with Maps / GIS / Computational Geometry data is a strong plus, Experience in Spark, AWS, Kubernetes, Jenkins


Compensation and Benefits
Benefits

As a full-time Tesla Intern, you will be eligible for:
  • Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
  • Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
  • Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans. Both have an option with a $0 payroll contribution
  • Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Medical Plan with HSA
  • Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
  • LGBTQ+ care concierge services
  • 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
  • Company Paid Basic Life, AD&D, and short-term disability insurance
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Sick time after 90 days of employment and Paid Holidays
  • Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
  • Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
  • Commuter benefits
  • Employee discounts and perks program


Expected Compensation

$36.06 - $50.48 + benefits

Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.

Tesla is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.
Tesla is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. Please let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the interview process.

full-desc:
LG's Mission is to be #1 by creating a better life for our customers. At LG we make products and services that make lives better, easier and happier through increased functionality and fun. Put simply, we offer the latest innovations to make “Life Good”! As a global leader, we strive for greatness not only in the products we make but in our people. That is why we are currently seeking the newest innovator to join our dynamic team as an Intern on the ThinkQ Data Solutions Team located in Englewood Cliffs, NJ.

Life's Good, Reinvent Your Future

LG's 2024 Summer Internship Program will be a 9-week internship from June 3rd through August 2nd, 2024.

The internship will be based in office at the LG North America Innovation Campus in Englewood Cliffs, NJ and pay an hourly rate of $23.50.

The LG Internship Program is built on the philosophy of ensuring that each intern is given the opportunity to perform robust and meaningful work while gaining real-world experience.

The program will also include each intern working on an individual strategic project for the department and delivering a presentation at the program’s end.

Responsibilities

  • Data Solutions Development which includes market analysis, requirements gathering, conceptual design, POC.
  • Software solution mockup design, web application development and deployment.
  • Develop dashboard and demonstrate value for the customer. Embrace LG’s consumer experience marketing strategy built on a data-driven marketing mindset

Framework: Django, Slim, Angular, React
Cloud: Azure/AWS

Project Summary

ThinQ Solutions platform is developed for hosting multiple B2B solutions to enhance and our services offering to our customers. Solutions platform is meant to.,
1. Boost our product sale such as Hydro kits, Multi V VRF systems, EV Charges and Commercial Energy Storage Devices.
2. Bring monthly monetizable benefits to LGE.

  • Proficient in couple of computer programing languages
  • AI/ML academic experience
  • Polished written and oral communications. Ability to develop and present compelling, engaging and polished PowerPoint presentations that inform and inspire.

full-desc:
About us:
One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.
What you'll do:
The Ground Infrastructure team is responsible for the infrastructure that provides transport network, data (processing) centers and the networks within, access underlay infrastructure, and general shared services which are hosted in the data centers required to connect a subscriber to the internet.
The day-to-day:

This intern will implement monitoring for all data that needs be retained for legal purposes. We are required by legal compliance to monitor if the various required logs and reports are being uploaded to S3. Failure to load these to S3 properly can cause us to be out of compliance. This epic covers creating the lambda job, graphs, and alerting for data retention legal requirements.

What you'll need:
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree or higher in computer science or a related field
  • Python programming
  • Ansible, Terraform or other automation frameworks
  • Git
  • Infrastructure as code
  • AWS, specifically Lambda and S3
  • Ability to work with HTTP APIs
  • Ability to commit to a 10-12 week internship
  • US Citizenship required
What will help you on the job:
  • Ability to work both autonomously and as a team
  • Critical thinking and problem solving
Salary range: $21 - $66 / hourly : At Viasat, we consider many factors when it comes to compensation, including the scope of the position as well as your background and experience. Base pay may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Additional cash or stock incentives may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. Learn more about Viasat’s comprehensive benefit offerings that are focused on your holistic health and wellness at careers.viasat.com/LifeAtViasat/Benefits. EEO statement:

Job Summary

As the Desktop Support Intern you will work with our client to learn and provide technical and logistical support.

Job Description

We are looking for a Desktop Support Intern to provide technical and logistic support to our client. This is position will be part-time and on-site.

What You'll Do

  • Provide level 2 technical support to over 2500 county staff, monitor work queues, open, update and close ServiceNOW Incidents

  • Basic Installation of desktop hardware / peripherals and printers

  • Thoroughly and accurately document the details of a user request or issue, document the diagnostic steps performed when troubleshooting the issue

  • Installation of individual software packages, as needed, for all users

  • Have a great attitude and willingness to learn

  • Perform various warehouse activities pertaining to IT peripherals

What You'll Need

Required:

  • Currently enrolled in a two year or four year technical college or university

  • Some Knowledge of data communication and network concepts, principles, and fundamentals

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

  • Customer-Oriented

  • Detailed-oriented with solid documentation skills

Preferred:
