The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year-round program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by giving them ownership over projects that are critical to their team’s success.

About the Team
As a member of the Visualization Team, you will be responsible for the design and creation of digital assets and environments, as well as real-time and pre-rendered photorealistic automotive and product visualizations. Your work has the potential to be seen on a global scale, helping influence people and communities to accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable energy.

What You’ll Do
  • Creation of realistic and fictitious virtual environments and assets
  • Optimization of assets and scenes for use in both real-time and pre-rendered environments
  • Ability to create good topology 3D models within pre-determined polygon count limits
  • Material generation and virtual material prototyping (PBR pipeline)
  • Environmental atmospheric and lighting setups, UV and texturing
  • Rendering high-quality, photorealistic vehicle and product content
  • Scanning (photogrammetry) of real-world, organic environments and assets
What You’ll Bring
  • Currently pursuing a degree with a graduation date between 2024 - 2025
  • Strong portfolio displaying your amazing skills as a 3D generalist with special attention to Vehicles and Environments
  • Solid artistic and technical knowledge
  • Knowledge of PBR based workflows and software (e.g., Substance 3D)
  • Ability to understand color, visual compositions, and lighting
  • Strong knowledge of traditional DCC tools (e.g., Maya, 3ds Max, Blender, Zbrush, Photoshop)
  • Experience with photogrammetry and knowledge of processing software (e.g., Reality Capture) a plus
Compensation and Benefits
Benefits

As a full-time Tesla Intern, you will be eligible for:
  • Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
  • Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
  • Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans. Both have an option with a $0 payroll contribution
  • Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Medical Plan with HSA
  • Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
  • LGBTQ+ care concierge services
  • 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
  • Company Paid Basic Life, AD&D, and short-term disability insurance
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Sick time after 90 days of employment and Paid Holidays
  • Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
  • Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
  • Commuter benefits
  • Employee discounts and perks program


Expected Compensation

$33.65 - $47.12 + benefits

Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.

Tesla is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.
Tesla is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. Please let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the interview process.

fragmented_desc: ["Currently be pursuing a Master's or PhD degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Software Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or a related field."]
full-desc:
With a focus on Mobility, Operational Excellence, Value to our Customers and the Electrification of vehicles, you can expect to be part of something exciting at Nissan. We exemplify ingenuity in everything we do, from the sleek design of our vehicles to the unique opportunities we offer around the globe. Our people are what drive the business forward and we are looking for researchers who want to challenge themselves, test their skills, develop their talents, and discover their full potential.

We're currently looking for an Autonomous Systems Research Intern to join our team in June 2024. On our team, we focus on scene understanding, road user prediction, trajectory planning, and autonomous vehicle simulation. Our prediction and planning system is required to produce human-like behavior in challenging real-world scenes including decisive high-speed highway driving to nuanced low-speed city scenes with pedestrians, cyclists, and other vehicles. As a member of the Autonomous Systems team, you will get to research and develop prediction and planning algorithms that scale from simple scenes to complex intersection thereby ensuring predictable, safe, and human-like autonomous vehicle behavior.

Think you've got the internal drive to support the production of great vehicles and join a winning team? Apply for this position and start the process to kick your career into high gear.

During the course of your internship, you will have the chance to:
  • Develop state-of-the-art perception, prediction or planning algorithms
  • Be responsible for testing your algorithms in simulation and real-world vehicles
  • Engage with other Autonomous Vehicle researchers

In order to qualify for this role, you must:
  • Currently be pursuing a Master's or PhD degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Software Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or a related field
  • GPA of 3.0 or above
  • Strong C++ or python coding ability
  • Strong organization ability with keen attention to detail
  • Be self-motivated and willing to challenge yourself to develop your talents and skillsets
  • Strong communication skills both written and oral

Welcome to an open lane of possibility. We know you have the capability to change the world, and we want you to help us change the future of automotive. Drive your career forward and join the company leading the technology and business evolution of the automotive industry by applying today.

Nissan is committed to a drug-free workplace. All employment is contingent upon successful completion of a drug screen for roles based in the United States and background screening for all positions.

Salary Range Estimate: $44/hr-$48/hr. This compensation range is provided as a reasonable estimate of the salary range for the job's grade level. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include, among other things, your specific skills, your work location, how many years of experience you have, and comparison to other employees already in this role.

All of us at Nissan - regardless of functional area or expertise - share a passion to design, manufacture, and sell high-performance vehicles. It is Nissan's policy to provide Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, gender, military status, disability, or any other status protected by law. Candidates for this position must be legally authorized to work in the United States and will be required to provide proof of employment eligibility at the time of hire; Nissan uses E-Verify to validate employment eligibility. **Visa sponsorship for this position is not available at this time."
Santa Clara California United States of America

Essential Functions:

The Maryland Judiciary is now hiring for an intern in Research and Analysis. Positions will generally last 90 days. Duties vary but may include the following: analyze datasets and identify trends and anomalies, perform data quality tests; run reports; communicate with courts about data quality and court operations practices and procedures; answering data quality questions; reviewing case files; researching Maryland law; data entry into Excel or other templates; and other related duties as assigned.

High school graduate with applicable documentation authorizing to work in the State of Maryland, e.g., Work Permit. Some college preferred.

Experience:

Applicants need not have job-related experience, but previous experience in general office environment is preferred. Current student pursuing BA/BS degree with coursework including research methods or statistics or equivalent.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Proficiency with MS Excel, strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills, strong attention to detail, good written and oral communication skills. Ability to process, verify, proofread and file miscellaneous reports and documents. Ability to operate office equipment such as a computer, printer, and photocopier.

The Maryland Judiciary is a drug-free workplace and an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, familial status, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by State or federal law. full-desc:
Position Overview

Objective: Ringer Sciences is the data science and analytics partner of The Next Practice, a founder-driven collective of firms that form common teams to create perpetual competitive advantage and value for our clients, through our Internship Program. Participants will gain real-world experience working at a data science & analytics firm, part of a fully integrated marketing agency, with a focus on learning and expanding our data-driven deliverables for our clients across multiple industries. Additionally, you will gain experience working on projects with the team and independently to answer direct client asks.


For more information about Ringer Sciences, please visit us at https://www.ringersciences.com.

For more information about The Next Practice Group, please visit us at www.nextpracticegroup.com.

Internship Program Date: 6/3/2024 - 8/2/2024

Intern Expectations:

  • ~40 hours a week of internal and client work
  • This position is currently remote
  • Online and available between the hours of 9 AM – 5 PM (CST) Monday – Friday

Internship Goal: By the end of the summer, we want our interns to gain skills, knowledge, and experience across a variety of issues, including:

  • Learn how to conduct a social listening conversation analysis
    • Identify stakeholder groups from mentions
    • Check sentiment coding and conduct sentiment analysis
    • Analyze top topics across mentions
    • Identify spikes in conversation and why those spikes occurred
    • Understand how different stakeholder groups utilize various social platforms
    • Identify top topics, segments, and influencers based on content performance
    • Pull verbatims and analyze sentiment on specific topics
    • Identify top-performing hashtags
  • Learn how to conduct paid media reporting
    • Learn paid media terminology (programmatic, OTT, OLV)
    • Learn formulas for paid media (CPM, CTR, CPC)
    • Pull insights from MoM results
  • Learn how to conduct an influencer analysis
    • Identify specific stakeholders on social media
    • Identify specific stakeholders through keywords in Meltwater data
    • Understand how to measure and evaluate social influence (Relevance, Resonance, and Reach)
    • Pull friends/followers of influencers using the Friends/Followers Tool
    • Analyze trends across demographics and personas
  • Learn how to create a high-level analysis for pitch decks
  • Learn how to determine the appropriate type of analysis based on research questions and client goals
  • Learn data visualization best practices to appropriately demonstrate data and insights

Gain experience working across a variety of industries, including:

  • Financial Services & Banking
  • Energy Sustainability
  • Healthcare
  • Consumer
  • Government Security


Ringer Sciences provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, creed, religion, age, sex, national origin, mental or physical handicap or disability, genetics, citizenship status, alienage, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

  • THIS ROLE IS NOT FULL-TIME; YOU WILL NOT BE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE BENEFITS LISTED BELOW.

The Summer Intern will work as part of the applications team to help support Canon Nanotechnologies (CNT) imprint tools and technologies, with an emphasis on process development for semiconductor applications, and metrology support. full-desc:
Summary
The Jackson Laboratory (JAX), a nonprofit biomedical research organization, is looking for summer interns to join its Advancement Operations team. Over the course of 8-10 weeks, you'll have the opportunity to learn from experienced prospect research and advancement service professionals about how to conduct prospect research to expand fundraising capacity. In addition, you'll gain an understanding of the sophisticated correlation between data management and analytics and strategic decision-making.
About Your JAX Internship Experience
Join peers selected from educational institutions across the country for a summer of professional growth and career exploration. As a JAX Intern, you will receive a dedicated mentor in your department and connect with your fellow interns through JAX-sponsored activities.
The start date for this position is by June 3, 2024.
Key Responsibilities
  • Assist the Advancement Operations team with priority data management and enhancement projects.
  • Provide program support in the areas of donor relations and engagement, prospect research, and data and gift management.
Desired Qualifications
JAX encourages applications from a diverse mix of educational backgrounds and experiences. Preferred qualifications include:
  • Must currently be enrolled at an accredited institution
  • Pursuing an undergraduate degree in business or a related field
  • Comfort working with online resources and learning new applications.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Outlook. Advanced Excel expertise is preferred.
  • Detail-orientated, dedicated to accuracy, and tolerance for repetitive work.
  • Experience working effectively independently to contribute to team success.
  • Self-motivated, naturally curious and enthusiastic to learn.
  • A high degree of confidentiality is expected.
Submission of a resume and cover letter is required for this role.
The hourly rate is $17.50-25.00 per hour. Hourly rate will be determined based on qualifications and experience.
#LI-MJ1
#CA-MJ4
About JAX:
The Jackson Laboratory is an independent, nonprofit biomedical research institution with a National Cancer Institute-designated Cancer Center and nearly 3,000 employees in locations across the United States (Maine, Connecticut, California), Japan and China. Its mission is to discover precise genomic solutions for disease and empower the global biomedical community in the shared quest to improve human health.
Founded in 1929, JAX applies over nine decades of expertise in genetics to increase understanding of human disease, advancing treatments and cures for cancer, neurological and immune disorders, diabetes, aging and heart disease. It models and interprets genomic complexity, integrates basic research with clinical application, educates current and future scientists, and provides critical data, tools and services to the global biomedical community. For more information, please visit
www.jax.org
.

CooperVision, a division of CooperCompanies (NASDAQ:COO), is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of soft contact lenses. The Company produces a full array of daily disposable, two-week and monthly contact lenses, all featuring advanced materials and optics. CooperVision has a strong heritage of solving the toughest vision challenges such as astigmatism, presbyopia and childhood myopia; and offers the most complete collection of spherical, toric and multifocal products available. Through a combination of innovative products and focused practitioner support, the company brings a refreshing perspective to the marketplace, creating real advantages for customers and wearers. For more information, visit www.coopervision.com

Reporting to the Sr. Global Data Analyst, this internship position will help to support project analytics for global BI and Data initiatives.

full-desc:
Responsibilities

We are the Marketing Technologies (MarTech) Solution Organization, ⁓15 people dispatched between US and France. You will join the team of 3 people based in our NAM HQ in Waltham, MA.

Our purpose is to support, at world-wide scale, the acquisition, nurturing, and qualification of our prospects across multiple teams, from Marketing, Business Development, and Sales. In order to do so, we manage and support multiple applications, such as Marketing Automation Platform, CRM, other prospection tools, and a Marketing Data Lake.

As a CRM Business Analyst, your primary mission is to contribute to the global deployment, usage and optimization of the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system dedicated to prospection activities. You will make sure of its effectiveness, adoption and alignment with the strategic drivers and business goals, across multiple brands, channels and geographies.

This internship involves:

  • Being proactive in identifying CRM-related challenges and opportunities
  • Contributing to the definition and validation of the change requests from our stakeholders (Business Development, Sales, Marketing, Strategy, …)
  • Mapping these requests to the corresponding features in the tools (existing or to be built)
  • Configuring the tools involved accordingly
  • When development is required, collaborate with the technical teams involved
  • Testing and validating these new features/changes along with the QA team
  • Deploying these changes, interacting with the user community globally, and the power users specifically
  • Monitoring and supporting the adoption and gathering data/feedback from our stakeholders and users

This is a 5-6 month paid internship with a flexible start date in the Dassault Systèmes Corp. offices located at 175 Wyman Street Waltham, MA 0245. You will be expected to follow a hybrid work model (three days in office, two days work from home).


#LI-HYBRID

Shape your career with 3DS! #WeAre3DS

Qualifications

  • Degree in Information Systems, Business or Computer Science
  • Familiar with Sales & Marketing processes and/or applications (CRM, Automations ...)
  • Comfortable working and interacting in a dynamic, global environment with cross functional teams, cultures, regions, brands, and channels.
  • Analytical skills, including database querying, data analysis
  • Ability to synthetize and communicate with different stakeholders.
  • Be pro-active in identifying and resolving challenges

Preferred

  • Experience with a major CRM Platform (HubSpot, SalesForce, Siebel...)
  • A good understanding of B2B sales prospection

As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.

Equal opportunity

In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at 3DS are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. 3DS is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, familial status, national origin, ancestry, age (40 and above), disability, veteran status, military service, application for military service, genetic information, receipt of free medical care, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. 3DS will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

full-desc:
Financial Analytics Intern, Hybrid, Lexington, MA
The Analytics team at Mimecast is looking for a passionate and highly motivated Financial Analytics Intern. As an intern, you’ll be supporting the BI & Analytics team on data analysis, reporting, and analytics for different financial departments across the company. Potential projects include building dashboards to track KPIs; preparing and transforming data for new datasets and models; and helping to integrate new data sources such as product usage data for new products. This is a great opportunity to gain real, hands-on experience with business intelligence tools and processes.
You’ll work with analysts, operations, data engineering, data science and other functions to build data models, processes, methodologies and outcomes for our customers and stakeholders.
The ideal candidate will be an inquisitive learner with a passion for data and analytics who can collaborate with stakeholders across all functional areas to review and optimize reporting, analytics, and data enablement all while aligning to corporate objectives. This role requires a mixture of business acumen and technical expertise, along with an ability to build strong partnerships and relationships.
At Mimecast, you’ll find a smart group of people who value hard work while working in a casual and fun environment. We are regularly voted one of Boston area's Best Places to Work!
What You’ll Do
  • Use data-driven methods and work with analysts and analytic engineers to improve our analytics landscape and ability to turn insight into action
  • Gain experience working with stakeholders from various functional areas within the company
  • Fine tune your skills in data analysis, dashboard building, project management, data science, data modeling and data governance to support Mimecast's data-driven mission
  • Analyze data to drive real insights to our Finance, Sales, Go-To-Market, Customer, and Product teams
  • Utilize project management skills to navigate complex problems
  • Create dashboards and build reports concisely and impactfully
  • Advance BI team & corporate goals, promoting a data-oriented culture, insight generation and enablement of end-users.
  • Ad-hoc analysis as required to aid management decision making and business planning.
What You’ll Bring
  • Self-starter & team player with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • B.S. degree in Math, Business, Economics, Finance, Information Systems or related discipline
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent quantitative skills – demonstrated proficiency with analyzing, summarizing and presenting complex data in a clear and compelling manner
  • Strong business acumen – interest in understanding business issues and developing data solutions for business needs A high attention to detail and possess a passion for data, data quality & business analytics.
  • Excellent communication & interpersonal skills, utilizing data to tell a story.
  • Ability to work independently and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite; Experience with SQL, R, SAS, and/or Python is a plus
  • Experience in leveraging a modern analytics stack using Snowflake/any RDBMS and Tableau, Domo, MSFT Power BI is a plus
  • Understanding/exposure to Netsuite, Salesforce or other CRM tools is a plus
#LI-ND1

Cybersecurity is a community effort. That’s why we’re committed to building an inclusive, diverse community that celebrates and welcomes everyone – unless they’re a cybercriminal, of course.
We’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and we’d encourage you to join us whatever your background. We particularly welcome applicants from traditionally underrepresented groups.
We consider everyone equally: your race, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ability, marital status, nationality, or any other protected characteristic won’t affect your application.
If you require any adjustments or accommodations due to a disability, or any other reason that may help you in your interview process, please let us know by emailing careers@mimecast.com.
Due to certain obligations to our customers, an offer of employment will be subject to your successful completion of applicable background checks, conducted in accordance with local law.

full-desc:
This is a project based contract role for a total of 1-3 days at an estimated 8 hours per day in our Palo Alto office. There is an opportunity for similar repeat projects in the future.

Our mission is to drive manufacturing efficiencies through technology that empowers teams to build products better, faster, and with less waste. Brands like Bose, Cisco, and SolarEdge use our technology to optimize their manufacturing processes and deliver superior products in less time.

We are looking for a Data Annotator who will be tasked to review images of electronic or mechanical products and annotate if there are any product defects and/or the types of defects. Data annotation is a critical part of the machine learning model development process and our Annotator will work closely with the ML team in this crucial step in ML development. As we plan to periodically review new units and update data labels, there could be further opportunities to work with the ML team depending on the progress in this task.

This could be an ideal role for individuals starting their career (or potentially still within school) to gain exposure to common problems that occur in electrical & hardware products. Individuals pursuing an Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering degree with an additional interest in start-ups or the ML space, might find this role particularly exciting. Our ML team is incredibly thoughtful & collaborative – a great place to learn & grow if you’re early in your career.

This role reports to the Head of Machine Learning. We estimate around 8 hrs/day, 1-3 days based on the completion of the project.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Learn about typical types of defects in electronic or mechanical products
  • Review images of electronic or mechanical products and annotate if there is any product defect and/or the type of defects
  • Working with our ML team to complete the data annotation within the timeline

We're Looking for Someone Who:

  • Experience in electronics and/or mechanical product design and development
  • Experience in ML model development is a plus
  • Able to follow written work instructions and provide feedback for improvement
  • Local to the Bay Area, and able to be in-person at our Palo Alto office
  • Bonus: Has experience as a technician, as a factory operator, or on an assembly line and is comfortable taking apart electronics.
We’re a growing team that consistently works collaboratively, is supportive of each other, and is highly energized by the opportunity for large impact. We actively work to promote an inclusive environment, valuing passion and the ability to learn. You’re encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn’t precisely match the job description!

The following is a representative hourly rate range for this position within the Bay Area: $28 - $32/hour.

All candidates must have an unrestricted right to work in the U.S.

full-desc:
Best Egg is the leading financial confidence platform that provides flexible solutions to real-life challenges for people with limited savings. We leverage real-time customer insights and data science to connect more people with the right products for their financial needs. Our offers include a growing suite of products such as personal loans, a credit card, and flexible rent, which are complemented by a suite of financial health tools to help customers make smart financial decisions and stay on track, so they can be money confident no matter what life throws at them.
Our culture and values inspire our employees and customers to embrace Best Egg. We are committed to championing a culture of inclusiveness and diversity of thought, and we focus on providing a safe, flexible, and collaborative work environment. Our employees are encouraged to engage in creative problem solving, and we promote opportunities for growth and enrichment across the organization.
If you are inspired by inspiring others, Best Egg is the place for you.

Best Egg promotes diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better we will grow.

Best Egg is seeking a Data Science Co-op who is eager to contribute to loan application analytics help identity friction in the application funnel and improve conversion rate. You can expect to enjoy a culture embracing the concepts of continuous delivery, total quality management, knowledge sharing, personal and career advancement, empowerment, innovation, and collective ownership.

This role will report to the Data & Science Advanced Analytics Department

Duties & Responsibilities

    • Improve funnel conversion by partnering with Marketing, Credit/Fraud on better designing application and verification process leveraging test and learn data.
    • Assist in developing and maintaining reporting and monitoring around funnel performance metrics leveraging SQL, excel or reporting tools such as PowerBI
    • Automate reporting utilizing Python and MetaFlow
    • Conduct A/B experimental testing impact analysis and make business recommendations.
    • Perform analysis, summarize findings, and present results to internal clients.

Ideal fit for this role:

    • Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Operational Research, Engineering, Data Science or other quantitative major required
    • A graduate student is required.
    • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
    • Intermediate to advanced experience with MS Excel and SQL server.
    • Experience with one or more large data mining and analytical tools: Python, R, or SAS is preferred
    • Experience with BI and digital reporting tools such as Power BI, and Adobe Analytics is preferred.
    • Ability to work effectively independently and as a team member.
    • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.
$20 - $24 an hour

Our Brand:
At Best Egg, we believe money should be accessible so people can reach their goals, live a fuller life, and feel pride in knowing they have taken control of their finances. For those who need extra money to achieve the progress they seek in life, Best Egg is the modern solution-minded finance provider that mixes decades of banking experience with smart technology and deep customer insight to create products designed for today’s borrower, so that people can establish a smoother financial path. The egg symbolizes protection and a fresh start.

Employee Benefits
Best Egg offers many additional benefits for our employees, including (but not limited to):
  • Pre-tax and post-tax retirement savings plans with a competitive company matching
program
  • Generous paid time-off plans including vacation, personal/sick time, paid short-
term and long-term disability leaves, paid parental leave, and paid company
holidays
  • Multiple health care plans to choose from, including dental and vision options
  • Flexible Spending Plans for Health Care, Dependent Care, and Health
Reimbursement Accounts
  • Company-paid benefits such as life insurance, wellness platforms, employee
assistance programs, and Health Advocate programs
  • Other great discounted benefits include identity theft protection, pet insurance,
fitness center reimbursements, and many more!

In compliance with the CCPA, Best Egg is fully committed to handling the personal information and data of employees and job applications responsibly with respect and due care.

At XiFin, a culture of inclusivity is in our very fabric. We believe that this culture not only creates a more equitable and functional workplace, but also enhances our team members' work experiences by promoting creativity, innovation, and collaboration. Won’t you bring your unique talents and perspectives and join us to deliver The Power To Do Good?


Who are we looking for?

The Quality Assurance Automation Intern will be responsible for creating, updating, and maintaining automated QA scripts within our pharmacy applications. You are inquisitive by nature, maintain a professional temperament, and have the desire to learn in a corporate environment.

This is a 10-week program beginning June 5, 2024, and ending August. 16, 2024. This will be a part-time (up to 29 hours/week maximum) with the potential to go full-time in the future role.


What does this position pay?

The hourly compensation for this role is $20.00 for undergraduate students and $21.00 for graduate students.


What will you do?

  • Work on Strand-Rx and CareCLAIM integration projects.
  • Work with REST and SOAP based API’s, Selenium browser automation and relationship databases (SQL) interactions.
  • Integrate with the scrum team and take part in scrum ceremonies.


What education and experience do you need?

A combination of the following education and experience factors will be considered:

  • Must be currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program or higher in CS, CE or related field.
  • Experience with Java
  • Experience and knowledge of writing development requirements, designs, and coding in various program languages and support in test in the lifetime of a product.
  • Prior work on software development projects and participation in code reviews.
  • High attention to detail and expertise problem solving skills.


Why XiFin?

XiFin, Inc. is a San Diego-based healthcare information technology company that provides innovative solutions to deliver efficiency, interoperability, and simplicity to help organizations navigate an increasingly complex and evolving healthcare landscape. From streamlined operations to automation and stronger financial tools coupled with industry-leading business strategy, XiFin gives healthcare providers The Power To Do Good for more patients. We are self-driven innovators who are looking to make a difference in the healthcare technology space.


If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the application or recruiting process, please contact us at 858-436-2901.

full-desc:
About DrFirst:
DrFirst is an innovative Health IT company with a mission to create user-friendly solutions so that doctors can treat their patients quickly, efficiently, and safely. Over 300,000 healthcare professionals, 120,000 prescribers, 67,000 pharmacies, and 60% of the healthcare IT vendors in the market depend on us every day to reduce clinical errors and improve patient outcomes. This is a great opportunity to be a part of a successful Healthcare IT company experiencing significant growth. We have a proven product, brand-name customers, and are backed by leading investors. Here you'll get to work with some of the smartest and most interesting people around; solving unique and complex challenges in healthcare on a scale matched by a few companies. If you get excited about stretching yourself in new ways, developing yourself to your fullest potential, care about working with smart colleagues; we want to talk to you!
Position Overview:
The Patient Solutions team is looking for an intern to address specific project requirements, focusing on code cleanup and upgrading additional projects from older java.util.Date/Calendar timekeeping classes to the new java.time.Instant time classes.

This is a full-time position that will span over the course of 10 weeks. The program will start Monday, June 1st, 2024 and end Friday, August 9th.

100% remote

fragmented_desc: ["Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science, or a related field. Your contributions coupled with our top tools/services on our Data Platforms…"]
full-desc:
Build Your Career at Informatica

We're looking for a diverse group of collaborators who believe data has the power to improve society. Adventurous, work-from-anywhere minds who value solving some of the world's most challenging problems. Here, employees are encouraged to push their boldest ideas forward, united by a passion to create a world where data improves the quality of life for people and businesses everywhere.

Data Analyst Intern

We are seeking a forward looking individual to join our effort to help our company achieve efficiency through AI. We have a position open for a Data Analyst Intern with data Analysis, data Science and web development knowledge to work on our key AI initiatives.

Position Overview:

A motivated Data Analyst Intern with a solid understanding of data science principles and web development skills to join our dynamic team. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to apply your analytical skills to real-world data, contribute to projects that drive business insights, and gain valuable experience in data analysis and web development. You will have the chance to integrate AI-driven functionalities seamlessly into web applications, enhancing user experiences with interactive data visualizations and predictive features. Your contributions coupled with our top tools/services on our Data Platforms running the Data warehouse, Datalake, Data Engineering and AI platforms will play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's capabilities in harnessing the power of data.

Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure data integrity and quality.

Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and insights within the data.

Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to extract meaningful information.

Data Visualization:

Create visually compelling dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to communicate findings effectively.

Utilize tools like Power BI to present insights in a clear and understandable manner.

Statistical Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and hypothesis testing to analyze data and validate findings.

Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of changes and make data-driven recommendations.

Web Development:

Assist in developing and maintaining web-based data applications and interactive visualizations.

Collaborate with the development team to integrate data-driven features and functionality into web platforms.

Utilize Typescript and React framework to enhance user experience and interactivity.

Documentation and Reporting:

Document process, analysis, methodologies, findings, and recommendations in clear and concise reports.

Qualifications:

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science, or a related field.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to derive insights from complex datasets.
  • Extensive experience w/Typescript
  • Proficiency in languages such as Python and SQL.
  • Familiarity with PowerBI
  • Understanding of web development concepts and experience with front-end technologies (HTML, CSS).
  • Knowledge of data manipulation and analysis libraries such as pandas, NumPy, and scikit-learn.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills with the ability to collaborate effectively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Self-motivated and eager to learn new technologies and techniques in data analysis and web development.
  • Preferred junior or senior level college student, with an expected graduation of 2025 or later. Ideally you will reside in the SF Bay area as you will work from our Redwood City CA office.

    This is a 12 week internship starting at the end of May or first of June 2024.

full-desc:
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
What to Expect
Consider before submitting an application:
This position is expected to start around August 2024 and continue through the entire Fall term (i.e. through December 2024) or into April 2025 if available. We ask for a minimum of 12 weeks, full-time and on-site, for most internships.
International Students: If your work authorization is through CPT, please consult your school on your ability to work 40 hours per week before applying. You must be able to work 40 hours per week on-site. Many students will be limited to part-time during the academic year.

The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize and develop emerging talent. Our year-round program places the best students in positions where they will grow technically, professionally, and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows the intern to experience life at Tesla by including them in projects that are critical to their team’s success.

Locations: Palo Alto, CA, Fremont, CA, Austin, TX, Reno, NV, Toronto, ON
What You’ll Do
Qualified applicants may be reviewed by one or more of the following teams:
Site Reliability Engineer Internship
  • The Cell Software team is responsible for building software solutions that allow the company to redefine manufacturing and production. We focus on implementing effective software advances, distributed fault-tolerant computing, and modern user- experience to manufacturing systems throughout Tesla. Our stack is built on top of Kubernetes, Helmfile, Ansible, GitHub Actions for automation procedures and Grafana, Prometheus, etc. for monitoring. Seeking candidates who have experience with Linux fundamentals, and understing of modern infrastructure services, distributed systems, microservices, and software design at a high-level. Experience in high level language such as Python, Go and/or Java; experience with Bash scripting.

Manufacturing Software Engineer Internship

  • Tesla is re-thinking how batteries are made from the ground up. We’re designing new factories, new equipment, new processes and new software to rapidly scale battery manufacturing, globally. The primary bottleneck to Tesla’s future expansion (and the transition to sustainable transport and energy storage) is our ability to produce and procure batteries – that’s why we’re innovating in-house, with our collection of world-class engineers, to redefine the industry. Software, data and automation all play a huge part in this strategy. Seeking a candidate with strong programming fundamentals: Go is preferred or knowledge on any other language, e.g., Python, Java, C#, etc. React, TypeScript and JavaScript. Docker and Kubernetes. Kafka as distributed event application. SQL experience and PostgreSQL. Understanding of complete SDLC, facilitating new features up to production. Unit Testing, Integration and E2E testing.

Software Engineering Internship

  • Tesla is seeking passionate software engineering students who thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to apply CS concepts to real world projects. Our Software Engineering teams are responsible for many of Tesla’s innovations, including Autopilot, Supercharging, and Infotainment! Seeking candidates who are proficient with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript/TypeScript. Experience with one or more of the following: Go, Python, C/C++ or other common industry languages.
What You’ll Bring
  • Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mechanical or related field
Compensation and Benefits
Benefits

As a full-time Tesla Intern, you will be eligible for:
  • Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
  • Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
  • Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans. Both have an option with a $0 payroll contribution
  • Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Medical Plan with HSA
  • Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
  • LGBTQ+ care concierge services
  • 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
  • Company Paid Basic Life, AD&D, and short-term disability insurance
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Sick time after 90 days of employment and Paid Holidays
  • Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
  • Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
  • Commuter benefits
  • Employee discounts and perks program


Expected Compensation

$20.00 - $60.00 + benefits

Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.

Tesla is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.
Tesla is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. Please let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the interview process.

full-desc:
At Eos, we believe in great chemistry. The combination of core elements into an amazing product and the mixture of skills into a unified team. We seek the best talent to just us in our mission to bring affordable, sustainable, clean energy to all. Come change the world with us.
At Eos Energy Storage, Inc. we believe outstanding employees build the foundation necessary for excellence in our journey toward a carbon-neutral power grid. It is with this belief that we are always looking for the best qualified and most talented employees to become part of our team. Eos Energy Storage offers advancement opportunities. A data analyst intern compiles and analyzes data to help companies make informed decisions. This role will focus on analyzing project data to support strategic development.
RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Understands the overall concept of the company, including the brand, customer, product goals, and all other aspects of Eos Energy service back to our marketplace.
2. Salesforce (CRM) administration
3. Deep dive data analytics for pipeline analysis
4. Assist in identifying new ways to maximize data usage to help develop new strategies to improve business venture
5. Energy Storage Market Research - Gather and validate information
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
  • Good communicator
  • Organized and detailed
  • Good interpersonal skills and confidentiality
  • Able to multitask and manage multiple priorities
  • Able to assist our Commercial Strategy Team in assigned tasks

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Third Year Bachelors Degree Student
0 - 6 months experience required
WORKING CONDITIONS
Office Environment - Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time and occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc. Required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading.
May be required to exert up to __50_____ pounds of force occasionally to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body.

WORK HOURS & BENEFITS
We can work with you on your schedule understanding that you are a student first. You can plan on being a part of our 300+ person team working 3 to 5 days per week during normal business hours on your assigned days. A highlight that sets Eos apart is you will be gaining experience in the Renewable Energy Sector and have an opportunity to meet our Senior Leaders as part of your internship. This network building aspect can be vital for the coming days as you approach graduation.

full-desc:
As a Data Analyst you will play a key role in analyzing financial and user level data to improve the in-app experience for our software customers. You should be a sharp, curious, and analytic individual who has a passion for diving into data and building models to understand how businesses are performing relative to their peers. Your financial data insights will influence product design to drive improved acquisition, retention, and monetization.

Description

As a Data Science Specialist on our Data Solutions team your core responsibilities will include:

  • Work closely with engineering directors, product leaders, global sales strategy, and executive leadership to ensure solutions alignment with engineering, product, and go-to-market priorities

  • Work with the VP of Operations, Kasey McKenney on Data Solutions initiatives, as well as the CEO and other key leaders to set a data-driven vision and direction for Predictive Analytics Definition and Commercialization at Upper Hand; oversee delivery and execution across the complete portfolio of SQL query management, ETL and ELT design and delivery, Data Analysis and Visualization and Predictive Analytics solutions

  • Mine large amounts of data and perform data analysis to extract useful business insights for a wide range of topics including product development and performance, market dynamics, consumer and audience knowledge, internal operations, and external research

  • Deliver presentations to senior leadership to explain and illustrate complex analytical findings

Benefits and Perks:
  • Medical: Upper Hand pays 80% of premium for both the employee and dependents
  • Dental and Vision: Upper Hand pays 50% premium for both the employee and dependents
  • 401K benefits offered through Guideline with premium offerings from Vanguard
  • Combined Personal Time Off (PTO): Unlimited days per year
  • Modern office with ergonomic Herman-Miller sit-stand desks, chairs and rotating dual monitor stands; Seven flat-screen tv’s with a relaxation room
  • Free coffee and tea with 16 flavors; complimentary snacks and other beverages
  • Company retreats and outings
  • Support for H-1B sponsorship

Salary

$20 - $25 per hour

full-desc:
Quality Assurance Test Intern


Virtual Peaker is looking for QA Test Interns that will help save the world by working to build the utility of the future. Renewable energy is going to save humanity, but the intermittent nature of wind and solar energy makes it much harder for electric utilities to keep the grid in balance. The Virtual Peaker Software as a Service platform helps utilities keep the grid in balance by interacting with residential IoT devices to change their behavior, thereby easing the transition away from fossil fuels.


Our approach to internship

  • Full integration with the QA Engineer team: make real contributions to testing our products; participate in the test process and team meetings
  • Mentoring: one-on-one support
  • Incrementalism: start with using our applications and learning about the test processes; progress to pair testing with an experienced QA Engineer; gradually increase the breadth and complexity of the testing tasks

Requirements

  • Ability to think critically, design experiments to discover software behaviors and document your findings
  • Demonstrable technical aptitude towards understanding how things work (eg: prior work experience, software/webpage projects, course work, etc.)
  • A strong desire to learn new skills and contribute to a team’s goals

The Virtual Peaker QA Engineer team uses automation tools Playwright and Pytest for regression testing. Candidates need not be familiar with these tools but should have an ambition to learn how to code automated tests.


Duration: 16 weeks


Hourly Pay: $18.00 - $22.00


Schedule: Up to 40 hours per week. Flexible schedule but ideally overlaps traditional working hours as much as possible


Location: Virtual Peaker is a remote-first company and is open to this position being 100% remote

full-desc:
Org Marketing Statement

Supporting aircraft worldwide, Parker Aerospace's Military Flight Controls Division (MFCD) provides primary and secondary flight control systems that make flight possible. Tested, proven and trusted in commercial and military applications for decades, MFCD provides precise position-control actuation solutions for military aircraft across the United States and with foreign partners. The division's JetPipe® electrohydraulic servovalve (EHSV) technology is used across commercial and military aircraft around the world. Headquartered in Irvine, California, the Military Flight Controls Division is the global leader in fly-by-wire flight control systems and electrohydraulic products and offers the world's most advanced motor design capabilities for flight controls.

Responsibilities

Provides technical support for users calling in to the IT Help Desk to increase computer user and system efficient. Diagnoses, identifies, and isolates basic hardware and software problems.

With direct supervision, you will learn and perform the various aspects of the engineering function by:

  • Teaching users on effective use of systems by answering questions, interpreting operating instructions, creating user documentation, developing training materials, and providing references.
  • Familiarity with reports using POWER BI, I/O office tools (Excel).
  • Basic to medium knowledge of excel (Vlookups, macros, etc).
  • Troubleshoot IT hardware issues (Printers, copiers, etc).
  • Familiarity with CAD applications, assist to convert/link documents to cloud applications.
  • Projects you will work on: Solumina data migration, enovia drawing updates.

T

Qualifications

The requirements to be part of the Programs are:

  • Being enrolled in a Bachelor’s or advanced degree program in a related IT field such as: Computer Sciences or Repairs
  • Must be entering their junior or senior year in Fall 2024
  • Ability to work effectively in a variety of engineering and manufacturing assignments.
  • Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Ability to work effectively with others and be a participative team member.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and CAD applications


Conditions of Employment

This role is subject to compliance with the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and the Export Administration Regulations (EAR), which requires the incumbent to be either a US citizen, lawful permanent resident [“green card” holders], or have refugee or asylee status).

fragmented_desc: ['Candidates should be seeking a Bachelors or Advanced degree in Computer Science, Electronics Engineering, or related field. Must be 18 years of age or older.']
full-desc:
Description

Millions of people experience Synaptics every day. Our technology impacts how people see, hear, touch, and engage with a wide range of IoT applications - at home, at work, in the car or on the go.

We solve complex challenges alongside the most influential companies in the industry, using the most advanced algorithms in areas such as machine learning, biometrics and video processing, combined with world class software and silicon development.

The EEPD Software Applications Internship is an opportunity to learn and develop your Embedded and AI skills by working with cutting edge AI technology with Synaptics open source Astra SDK. Our internship is designed for individuals who are currently enrolled at an accredited college/university and who will be continuing their studies in the fall.

The typical base pay range for this position is USD $30.00 - $52.50 per hour. Individual pay is determined by many factors including work location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Note that compensation listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only.

Job Duties

  • Understand application requirements and implement solutions based on Astra platforms
  • Develop sample applications and code snippets for common multimedia use cases, including video playback, streaming, and AI applications
  • Assist in the development and debugging of device drivers for Camera, HDMI, MIPI, Display, Audio, and other multimedia peripherals
  • Contribute to the creation of technical documentation, tutorials, and knowledge base articles for the Astra platform
  • Develop Edge AI applications for Astra platforms based on given AI models
  • Participate in the selection of AI models, their optimizations, and the creation of the infrastructure necessary to their verifications in terms of performance and accuracy

Competencies

  • Solid problem-solving skills and the ability to debug complex system-level issues
  • Well organized with strong attention to detail; proactively ensures work is accurate and error-free
  • Self-motivated and aptitude to learn quickly
  • Positive attitude and work ethic; unafraid to ask questions and explore new ideas
  • Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment

Qualifications

  • Candidates should be seeking a Bachelors or Advanced degree in Computer Science, Electronics Engineering, or related field
  • Basic understanding of embedded Linux development, Yocto Project, and BSP integration
  • Proficiency in C/C++ programming language
  • Some experience in Linux device driver development for multimedia peripherals such as Camera, HDMI, MIPI, Display, Graphics, Audio
  • Experience with the Linux graphics stack - Wayland, EGL, X11, Qt5 / Qt6 and QML
  • Familiar with multimedia frameworks including V4L2, ALSA, DRM-KMS and GStreamer
  • Familiar with AI frameworks and their integration with multimedia applications
  • Able to work independently at times and dedicate a minimum of 20 hours/week
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without restriction
  • Must be willing to submit to a background investigation, including verification of your employment and criminal history
  • Must be 18 years of age or older

Belief in Diversity

Synaptics is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to workforce diversity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, or genetic information.

fragmented_desc: ['Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining Ph.D. degree in computer science or a related field. The ideal candidate will be a Ph.D. student or recent…']
full-desc:
Sony AI America, a branch of Sony AI, is a remotely distributed organization spread across the U.S. and Canada. Sony AI is Sony’s new research organization pursuing the mission to use AI to unleash human creativity. Sony AI works closely with Sony’s other business units, including Sony Interactive Entertainment LLC., Sony Pictures Entertainment Inc., and Sony Music Entertainment. With some 900 million Sony devices in hands and homes worldwide today, a vast array of Sony movies, television shows and music, and the PlayStation Network, Sony creates and delivers more entertainment experiences to more people than anyone else on earth.
General Information:
Sony AI is looking for highly motivated and skilled Research Interns specializing in Generative Language Models, Natural Language Processing/Machine Learning (NLP/ML), and Reasoning/Explainability. The ideal candidate will be a Ph.D. student or recent graduate with a strong research background and a passion for advancing the state-of-the-art in language understanding, generative reasoning, and graph embedding. The internship requires a minimum of 3 months duration; ideally, you can commit for 6 months (early start dates preferred). During the internship, you will collaborate closely with mentors on all research aspects, from problem definition to developing innovative ML solutions and presenting findings at top-tier publication venues.

Roles and Responsibilities:
  • Conduct fundamental and applied research in generative AI and knowledge graph, focusing on tasks such as large-scale knowledge graph construction, graph embedding, representation learning and reasoning, and scalable training methods.
  • Contribute to the development of libraries and tools to support both research and business objectives.
  • Prepare reports and deliver presentations for internal audiences.
  • Publish impactful research outcomes in top-tier conferences.

Required Qualifications and Skills:
  • Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining Ph.D. degree in computer science or a related field.
  • Demonstrated expertise or publications in machine learning, unsupervised/semi-supervised methodologies, NLP, multimodal learning, representation and reasoning, efficient and scalable training, etc.
  • Exposure to large-scale text data processing and graph embedding techniques.
  • Excellent analytical and programming skills (Python) and experience with large-scale deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
  • Ability to communicate research in a clear and precise manner.

Working Location:
Remote (Global)
The target hourly rate for this internship is $50.00 per hour. The individual will be paid hourly and eligible for overtime.
#LI-AS1
Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex (including pregnancy), gender, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, military status, status as a veteran or disabled veteran, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or family status, genetic information, medical condition, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law, ordinance, or regulation.

or by mail to: Sony Corporation of America, Human Resources Department, 25 Madison Avenue, New York, NY 10010. Please indicate the position you are applying for.

full-desc:
At Repsol, we are committed to equality and do not request personal information.
We believe that diversity contributes to innovative ideas and provides added value that enables us to benefit from mutual learning and perform our best work. Here, what counts is your experience and your ability to create value. We offer you the opportunity to grow professionally, develop your career with challenging projects and collaborate with talented people worldwide. As a company committed to diversity and inclusion, we encourage all professionals who meet the job description requirements to apply.
Repsol is seeking a Data Analytics Intern to join our Technical E&P unit, located in The Woodlands, Texas for the summer of 2024 (May 20-Aug 9).
Repsol’s student employment program offers the following advantages:
  • Mentoring by experienced professionals in your field;
  • Increasing levels of challenge and responsibility as skill and industry knowledge grow;
  • The opportunity to gain hands-on experience and apply your academic knowledge;
  • Exposure to different technical groups across the company;
  • Technical and software training.
Location & Hours
  • Position will be supported onsite Mon-Fri at our US headquarters in The Woodlands, TX.
  • Internship shall begin on Monday May 20, 2024, and will conclude on Friday August 9.
  • Hourly pay rate (full time, 40 hr. week) plus one-time stipend in first payroll.
  • Non-local candidates will be responsible for their travel and temporary accommodations during the summer.
Primary Responsibilities and Expectations
  • Assist colleagues with the creation of data gathering and analysis.
  • Support technical teams to integrate large live data bases into useful business analytics.
Data Analysis:
  • Understand the difference sources of data used for subsurface evaluation.
    • Collect and analyze data from various sources to identify trends, pa
  • erns, and insights.
  • Prepare data visualizations and reports to communicate findings to the team.
  • Review existing data processing and dashboarding workflows and propose enhancements.
Data Management:
  • Assist in data cleaning, transformation, and maintenance to ensure data accuracy.
  • Support data governance initiatives to uphold data quality standards.
  • Understand corporate data storage and information management practices.
Team Collaboration:
  • Collaborate effectively with team members and provide analytical support as needed.
  • Contribute to a positive and innovative team environment.
  • Actively participate in meetings and discussions.
  • Support technical teams to integrate large live data bases into business analysis.
Required Education & Skills
  • Fully authorized to work for any employer in the US without sponsorship now or in the future. Additionally, we are not authorized for employment under OPT/CPT/F1 visa programs.
  • Successful completion of 2 years towards a Bachelor's (or higher) program. The intern should have an expected graduation date of Dec 2025-May 2026.
  • Strong interest in data analysis, business analytics, problem-solving, and critical thinking.
  • Ability to work with data and derive meaningful insights.
  • Knowledge of Data base creation and analysis (SQL, Access, etc.)
  • Knowledge in data analysis tools such as Excel, Python, R, or similar.
  • Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Spotfire, Power BI).
  • Basic understanding of statistical analysis and data modeling.
  • Preferred - Knowledge of routine automations (PowerShell, PowerAutomate, Flow or similar)
  • Preferred - Knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Detail-oriented, highly motivated, and organized.
  • Able to manage multiple tasks with responsibility and precision.
  • Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and analytical methods.
  • Ability to work independently and take initiative.
  • Willingness to ask questions and seek guidance when needed.
  • Ability to interact in a team environment.
  • Prior exposure to the Oil & Gas industry is preferred but not mandatory.
Repsol is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veteran

full-desc:
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
What to Expect
Consider before applying: This position is expected to start around Aug/Sep and continue through Dec/Jan. Internships are in-person for 40 hours a week for a minimum of 12 weeks. Please consider before submitting an application.
International Students: If your work authorization is through CPT, please consult your school before applying. You must be able to work 40 hours per week. Many students will be limited to part-time depending on their academic standing.
Internship Programs at Tesla

The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year-round program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by giving them ownership over projects that are critical to their team’s success.
Locations: Austin, TX / Bellevue, WA /Fremont, CA
About the Team
Our team is composed of product managers, business analysts, UX designers, and full stack software engineers, working together to create elegant solutions to complex problems. We run lean, move quickly, and pride ourselves on accelerating Tesla from start-up to scaled enterprise without losing our scrappy spirit.
As a member of the Product Management team, you will wear many hats and adapt to a fast-paced work environment. Internally, the team is responsible for representing the voice of our customers, but also for balancing priorities with business needs across multiple products. This is a multi-faceted role where strong knowledge of the energy sector, technology and analytics is a must. Besides a rock-solid work ethic and a strong team-oriented personality, members of our team display creativity, passion, and a desire to break new ground in a constantly shifting technology landscape.

What You’ll Do
  • Support Product Managers directly on all core and critical team efforts. Candidates are expected to own and drive multiple independent and collaborative efforts to completion
  • Support workstreams such as next-generation product spec and offering definition, new-market entry, service and maintenance topics, and more
  • Perform market and customer research, present tradeoffs and opportunities, and drive conclusive decisions with key technical and commercial stakeholders
  • Support the launch readiness of new products and offerings, by leading internal workstreams and creating and delivering collateral and training
What You’ll Bring
  • Currently pursuing a degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field of study with a graduation date between 2024-2025
  • Experience in cross-functional work spanning technical, financial, operational, and a strong desire to develop a deep understanding of customer and market requirements
  • Previous experience in product management is not required, a strong academic understanding of technical topics and an interest in operations/finance/strategy is required
  • Excellent organization, communication, and documentation skills
Compensation and Benefits
Benefits

As a full-time Tesla Intern, you will be eligible for:
  • Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
  • Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
  • Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans. Both have an option with a $0 payroll contribution
  • Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Medical Plan with HSA
  • Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
  • LGBTQ+ care concierge services
  • 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
  • Company Paid Basic Life, AD&D, and short-term disability insurance
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Sick time after 90 days of employment and Paid Holidays
  • Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
  • Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
  • Commuter benefits
  • Employee discounts and perks program


Expected Compensation

$32.45 - $45.43 + benefits

Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.

Tesla is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.
Tesla is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. Please let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the interview process.

full-desc:
Overview:

An AI Software Engineer (Intern) is an entry level engineering role responsible for designing and implementing AI solutions within ConnectiveRx’s technology group. They will grow creative and technical skills by suggesting, designing, and building AI solutions. This person will work with a single agile team at ConnectiveRx to complete specific projects across a potentially wide set of AI and full stack development technologies.

  • Work closely with senior engineers to understand and work on assigned projects
  • Participate in the full SDLC, including design sessions, project estimation, iterative development, and unit testing
  • Contribute to patterns and system designs, write code, and participate in code reviews

  • Contribute to the CRx platform by suggesting and implementing AI-based enhancements to existing frameworks, tools, and processes

Basic Qualifications:
  • Strong communication skills; ability to communicate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical team members
  • Strong problem solving skills; ability to design and implement complex technical solutions

  • Knowledge of LLMs, prompt engineering, fine tuning, and similar techniques
  • Experience with RAG frameworks such as Langchain, Llama Index, Haystack, or similar
  • Exposure to an OO language, databases, and multi-tier application development
  • Proficiency in Python programming and experience with popular ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with cloud technologies; particularly AWS/AI components such as Bedrock, Q, CodeWhisper, SageMaker, and the like

  • Prior exposure to or interest in healthcare technology and its applications in improving patient care and outcomes

full-desc:
For Earth For Life

Our Mission, Vision, and Values
Our mission, “For Earth, For Life,” speaks to our commitment to the preservation of the earth’s natural environment while aiding in production of food and water supplies that are vital to societal needs as our world population continues to grow. That mission is realized each time a Kubota tractor harvests the land to produce life sustaining food or our construction equipment excavates to transport water resources or provide shelter.

Program Overview
Kubota’s Internship program is intended to provide development in a professional environment that creates an opportunity for you to be successful now and in the future. Throughout the internship program, interns will have the opportunity to build relationships, collaborate with other interns, and attend social events, engage with leadership, and present a final capstone project.

Capstone Project
Interns will be assigned a Capstone project that will be presented to Executive leadership at the conclusion of the program. Each Capstone will provide the Intern with an opportunity to create solutions that display their perspective and acquired knowledge. These projects could even be implemented into our everyday business practices.

Duration: June to August
Length: 10 weeks
Hours: Monday through Friday (40 hours)
Salary: $18.00 hr.
Benefits: Housing stipend benefit available for those who qualify

Minimum Qualifications
  • Must be actively enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program at an accredited University, working toward a bachelor’s or master’s degree.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite including PowerPoint, Excel, and Word.
  • Strong interpersonal communication skills including verbal and written.
  • Ability to communicate with various levels of management, dealers, and customers.
  • High level of skill in decision making, problem solving and analytics.
  • Organizational, multi-tasking and prioritization skills.
  • Integrity, accuracy, dependability, enthusiasm, and confidentiality.
Must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship.

Kubota is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

full-desc:
For Earth For Life

Kubota’s Technology Office is seeking a Process Engineer Intern that will assist in the research, analysis, evaluation, and development of engineering processes for new technology development in Kubota North America.
This position will provide exposure to technology development across Kubota North America including development of off-road vehicles and implements. In this role, you will work on evaluating several processes related to the development of technology. Your responsibilities will include:
  • Efficiency studies of existing development processes,
  • Collaborating with stakeholders to provide recommendations to development processes,
  • Evaluate tools for efficiently implementing process improvements,
  • Write process documentation for new processes,
  • Support the training and rollout of these processes.
Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university, seeking a baccalaureate in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or an equivalent major.
Ability to clearly communicate technical information to non-technical users, both verbally and in writing.

Kubota is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.
