full-desc:
LG's Mission is to be #1 by creating a better life for our customers. At LG we make products and services that make lives better, easier and happier through increased functionality and fun. Put simply, we offer the latest innovations to make “Life Good”! As a global leader, we strive for greatness not only in the products we make but in our people. That is why we are currently seeking the newest innovator to join our dynamic team as HA Product Management Intern located in Englewood Cliffs, NJ. This role is ONSITE

Life's Good, Reinvent Your Future

LG's 2024 Summer Internship Program will be a 9 week internship from June 3rd through August 2nd, 2024.

The internship will be based in office at the LG North America Innovation Campus in Englewood Cliffs, NJ and pay an hourly rate of $28.50.

The LG Internship Program is built on the philosophy of ensuring that each intern is given the opportunity to perform robust and meaningful work while gaining real-world experience.

The program will also include each intern working on an individual strategic project for the department and delivering a presentation at the program’s end.

Responsibilities

  • Supporting Home Appliance PM Team
    Includes updating customer presentations for NPI, marketing, and customers
    Sales analytics reports
    Market analysis
    Exposure to sales calls with local sales team members
    Website audits for key retailers
    Competition benchmarking for products and websites
    Assisting with Product Samples in HA Showroom
  • Projects will focus on bench marketing customer and competitors for both product and customers
    This will help drive competitive insights that we can use to make LG more competitive in the channel
    Benchmark competitors exclusive models in the marketplace and work with PM team on insights
    Benchmark LG.com versus competitor online shops

Qualifications

  • Enrollment in a JD degree program at an accredited College/University and going into their second or third year
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Teams)
  • Analytical and well organized
  • Presentation / Customer Facing Ability
  • Ability to be self starter and not need day to day interaction
  • Email, Teams, and possibly OLAP

Consistent with our commitment to providing equal opportunity and embracing diversity, LG has implemented affirmative action to ensure applicants are employed and employees are treated without regard to these characteristics.

Join our team of more than 34,000 team members, supporting our members and communities in our Club Support Center, 235+ clubs and eight distribution centers. BJ’s Wholesale Club offers a collaborative and inclusive environment where all team members can learn, grow and be their authentic selves. Together, we’re committed to providing outstanding service and convenience to our members, helping them save on the products and services they need for their families and homes.

The Benefits of working at BJ’s

  • BJ’s pays weekly
  • Generous time off programs to support busy lifestyles*

o Vacation, Personal, Holiday, Sick, Bereavement Leave, Jury Duty

  • Benefit plans for your changing needs*

o Three medical plans**, Health Reimbursement Account (HRA), Health Savings Account (HSA), two dental plans, flexible spending

  • eligibility requirements vary by position

**medical plans vary by location

Your time, talent, ambition, and experience are priceless. Invest in the Management Development Summer Internship Program at BJ’s Wholesale Club for the highest return where personal and professional development matter and the value add is clear. A BJ’s internship means exposure to meaningful, tactical skills building and an opportunity for permanent placement through full integration into the business, executive-level exposure, and an individual special project with clear deliverables. We look forward to meeting you and hope to welcome you to our team soon!

Job Summary

BJ’s Wholesale Club is looking for an SAP Technical Intern to join our Management Development Summer Internship Program.

Major Tasks, Responsibilities, and Key Accountabilities

  • Support a variety of projects that will range in scale and complexity within the SAP Security Team.
  • Actively participate in scoping and design exercises for ongoing projects.
  • Create standard operating procedures, training documents and other learning aids.
  • Review and update existing SAP Security documentation.
  • Help support internal and external audit requests.
  • Collaborate with the Functional, Basis, Development, Integration and Business teams to provide secure solutions for existing and new business functionalities.
  • Partner with more experienced team members to develop key skillsets as they relate to SAP security, compliance, and risk management.
  • Learn and grow security analysis skills for different SAP applications.

Qualifications/Description

  • Rising senior majoring in Computer Science or Information Technology
  • Able to work hybrid schedule in Marlborough, MA
  • Must be proficient in Excel and PowerPoint
  • Experience with SAP Security a plus
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Team player able to work cross functionally.
  • Hardworking, curious and eager to learn

BJ's Wholesale Club is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity for all qualified team members and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, physical and/or mental disability, genetic information, atypical cellular or blood trait, marital and/or familial status, pregnancy, gender identity and expression, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

full-desc:
New Product Development – Supply Chain Management Intern – Future Leaders Internship Program

As a global leader in smart, healthy and sustainable buildings, our mission is to reimagine the performance of buildings to serve people, places and the planet. As a member of the Johnson Controls Future Leaders Internship Program, your valuable skill set, knowledge and passion will help us continue to excel in a dynamic and competitive global environment. Our Top 100 Internship Program is a unique opportunity to put classroom theory into practice while bolstering your resume and professional network. By joining a program that is rooted in community, connection, and memorable experiences, you will have an opportunity to transform your future. #internship

What’s in it for you?

  • Join hundreds of interns nation-wide for a summer of learning and fun:
    • Innovation Challenge
    • Volunteering opportunities
    • Executive Engagement
    • Development Sessions
  • Inclusive and diverse environment
  • Comprehensive benefits package including 401k, Medical, Dental and Vision care – Available day one

What you will do

Manage materials development room for Controls Engineering. Receive, inventory, track, kit, and label development materials for engineering builds, testing, and prototyping.


How you will do it:

  • Manage NPI part material storage and movement.
  • Ship, label and track all material for product development
  • Support material movement, storage and tracking to new lab location summer 2024
  • Support and maintain NPI material data, through excel queries, pivot tables and data base creations
  • Places orders, inventories engineering experimental material to support New Product Introduction (NPI).
  • Manage part movement between NPI build sites to support scheduled builds.


What we look for

Required Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled as a full-time student at an accredited U.S. college or university
  • Pursuing a degree in Finance, Operations, Supply Chain or Business
  • An effective communicator to all levels of the organization
  • Must have demonstrated computer skills, including use of Microsoft Excel
  • Being on site is required: 12 hours/week during the semester and FULL time during semester breaks and during the summer
  • Ideal candidates are freshmen or sophomore but also open to early juniors.
  • U.S. citizen or legal right to work in the U.S.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • High attention to detail
  • Able to work in a fast paced environment and adapt to change
  • Demonstrates an ability to learn quickly and independently
  • Strong communication skills (verbal and written) preferred
  • Strong problem-solving skills

full-desc:
Are you looking to start your career in clean energy? Nor-Cal Controls is excited to announce our summer engineering internship! This part-time, paid internship is designed for engineering college students who are interested in pursuing a career in renewable energy, power generation, and industrial controls. You will receive first-hand exposure with how a successful engineering company operates within the growing clean energy industry and gain valuable work experience to help with your career development.


What to Expect?

  • Internship program will go through June 3 – August 9, 2024.
  • Part-time (20-25 hours per week) at $20/hour.
  • Mentors will be assigned to you for the entire duration of the internship.
  • You will present what you learned to our leadership panel at the end of the program.

What Will You Be Doing?

  • Assembling and programming SCADA racks and MET stations.
  • Communication protocol development.
  • Human Machine Interface (HMI) development.
  • Real Time Automation Controller (RTAC) and Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) development.

Our Ideal Candidate:


  • College students majoring in mechatronics, electrical, mechanical, or computer engineering.
  • Some exposure to concepts related to controls and/or electrical power generation.
  • Has a genuine interest and passion for controls, power generation, and/or renewable energy.
  • Self-motivated, disciplined, eager to learn, and possesses a strong work ethic.

Nor-Cal Controls ES, Inc., located in El Dorado Hills, CA, has been a family-owned and operated business for over 15 years. From humble beginnings, we have grown to be the leading controls provider and systems integrator for renewable energies in the United States by adhering to our core values of Family, Dependability, Hard Work, Trust, and Knowledge. Our philosophy is simple: we take care of our clients by taking care of our employees. In addition to competitive compensation, excellent benefits, and flexible work options, we pride ourselves on having a healthy work environment that promotes diversity, collaboration, and professional growth.

job_title: CloseKnit Artificial Intelligence Intern - Summer Recruitment (Remote)
fragmented_desc: ['A rising Junior or Senior currently pursuing a Bachelors degree in Information Technology or a related field. The intern will play a crucial role in developing,…']
full-desc:
Resp & Qualifications

About Us:

In September 2021, we introduced CloseKnit: CareFirsts new Primary Care Practice. CloseKnit takes quality care personally. Were a new kind of patient-centric, virtual-first primary care practice. Open 24/7/365 through our convenient app. Our providers deliver care thats continuous, connected and uncomplicated.

At CloseKnit, we are at the forefront of integrating Artificial Intelligence into the everyday workflows of team members, patients, and providers workers. Our dedicated AI lab is focused on pioneering AI-backed solutions that streamline processes, enhance productivity, and empower our team with cutting-edge tools. We are committed to not just leveraging AI technology but also ensuring our workforce is adept at harnessing its full potential.

CloseKnit runs a year-round internship program. The ideal candidate is someone who can work throughout the year 15-20 hours in the Spring/Fall and up to 35-40 hours in the summer.

Role Overview:

We are seeking an enthusiastic AI Lab Intern to join our dynamic team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about artificial intelligence, eager to apply their knowledge in a practical, impact-driven environment. The intern will play a crucial role in developing, testing, and deploying AI solutions tailored to solve real-world problems faced by information workers.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Assist in the design and development of AI solutions that address specific challenges encountered by information workers.
  • Participate in the entire lifecycle of AI project development, including research, prototype development, testing, and deployment.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and feedback, ensuring that AI solutions are aligned with user needs and company objectives.
  • Contribute to the creation of training materials and workshops designed to educate employees on utilizing AI tools effectively.
  • Help creating training a training program to guide team members training in AI solutions.
  • Stay abreast of the latest AI trends and technologies, suggesting innovative ways to incorporate them into our solutions.
  • Document and report on research findings, development processes, and project outcomes.

Qualifications:

  • A rising Junior or Senior currently pursuing a Bachelors degree in Information Technology or a related field.
  • Strong foundational knowledge in AI, machine learning algorithms, and data processing.
  • Familiarity with AI development tools and frameworks.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to a non-technical audience.
  • Creative thinker with a keen interest in technology and innovation.

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on experience in a leading-edge AI lab, working on projects that have a tangible impact on the business.
  • A collaborative and inclusive work environment where innovation is encouraged and rewarded.
  • Comprehensive mentorship and guidance from industry experts.
  • Opportunity to enhance your technical skills and knowledge in AI applications in the workplace.
  • Networking opportunities within the company and the broader tech community.


Salary Range: $18,720 - $26,000

Salary Range Disclaimer

The hire range posted is an annual rate. All intern positions will be paid hourly.

Department

CloseKnit - Information Technology

Equal Employment Opportunity

CareFirst BlueCross BlueShield is an Equal Opportunity (EEO) employer. It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

Where To Apply

Please visit our website to apply: www.carefirst.com/careers

Federal Disc/Physical Demand

Note: The incumbent is required to immediately disclose any debarment, exclusion, or other event that makes him/her ineligible to perform work directly or indirectly on Federal health care programs.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

The associate is primarily seated while performing the duties of the position. Occasional walking or standing is required. The hands are regularly used to write, type, key and handle or feel small controls and objects. The associate must frequently talk and hear. Weights up to 25 pounds are occasionally lifted.

Sponsorship in US

Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without Sponsorship

full-desc:
Role Description & Responsibilities

Our Dassault Systemes IT team is excited to announce we have a hybrid internship opportunity available in our Waltham, MA office! As an IT support intern, you will be part of a dynamic team of 6 local IT service operations generalists. You will get exposure to a variety of IT support roles, a valuable hands-on experience in an innovative company.

The intern will assist with the delivery and setup of equipment for employee hardware upgrades and for new hires across the Waltham Campus, support end-user hardware and software issues, support events in conference and training rooms, and handle other hardware/software-related projects and tasks.

Strong communication skills are very beneficial. Attention to detail, friendly (will be speaking to many users as the intern will walk up to employee desks to check their hardware and software). Must be familiar with Windows and PC hardware. Some knowledge of networking and other operating systems (Mac OS and Linux) are a plus.

Strong communication skills in two parts

  • Very strong writing skills utilizing the rules of English grammar
  • Verbally clear, concise, and grammatically correct oral (speaking) communication skills in English

Must meet at least 8 of the following criteria:

  • Dedicated to a high level of customer service and follow through including excellent communication skills with peers, management, and business users
  • Experience with MS Windows, MacOS, and background in Active Directory
  • Experience with Microsoft SCCM and Operating System Deployment (OSD)
  • Ability to lift 40 lbs
  • Ability to research, design, and implement technical solutions to completion
  • Ability to work independently and/or within a collaborative team structure
  • Positive, self-motivated individual with high level of enthusiasm and willingness to learn and incorporate coaching and instructions into daily tasks and assignments
  • Highly organized with critical attention to details

Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, or a related field.
  • Basic understanding of cybersecurity principles and concepts.
  • Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, Java, or C++.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
  • Enthusiasm for learning and exploring new technologies, particularly in the field of artificial intelligence.
  • Ability to research, design, and implement technical solutions to completion. Ability to work independently and/or within a collaborative team structure

In addition to working with your direct team, as a member of Dassault Systemes NAM Intern Program you will be invited to our Speaker Series, Lunch and Learns, Networking Events and all employee functions.

We look forward to meeting with you and leaning why you feel you would make a great Dassault Systemes Intern.

Besides the above, a sense of adventure and a willingness to have fun through work are great tools at our disposal. If you enjoy learning new things while working with a friendly group of highly skilled individuals, this could be a great fit for you!

This is an onsite role at our Dassault Systèmes Waltham, MA location; no remote or offsite permitted

Shape your career with 3DS! #WeAre3DS #LI-Hybrid

Diversity statement

As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.

Equal opportunity

In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at 3DS are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. 3DS is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, familial status, national origin, ancestry, age (40 and above), disability, veteran status, military service, application for military service, genetic information, receipt of free medical care, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. 3DS will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

full-desc:
Title: Technical Assistant Intern - Images Everywhere

Location: [Blacksburg, VA]

Images Everywhere Inc. is a leading provider of Digital Imaging, Artistic, Special Events, and Consulting solutions within the leisure and tourism industry. Our innovative approach and dedication to excellence have made us a trusted partner for businesses seeking to enhance their offerings and engage customers in memorable experiences.

We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Technical Assistant to join our dynamic team. As a Technical Assistant, you will play a key role in supporting our digital imaging and artistic solutions, working closely with our team of professionals to deliver high-quality services to our clients.

Requirements:

- Proficiency in at least three different common programming languages, such as Python, JavaScript, Java, C++, or others.

- Strong background in image processing, computer vision, or related fields.

- Experience with digital imaging software and tools, such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or similar.

- Familiarity with web development frameworks and technologies, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript libraries.

- Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.

- Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field preferred.

Responsibilities:

- Collaborate with our team to develop and implement innovative digital imaging and artistic solutions for our clients.

- Design and implement software solutions to support our digital imaging and artistic services.

- Assist in the development and maintenance of web-based applications and platforms.

- Conduct research and development activities to explore new technologies and techniques.

- Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to clients as needed.

- Contribute to the continuous improvement of our processes and methodologies.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic and growing company in the leisure and tourism industry. We offer a competitive salary starting at $30 per hour, with the potential for growth up to $40 per hour based on experience and performance. In addition, we provide a comprehensive benefits package and opportunities for professional development.

Qualified candidates will undergo a thorough selection process, including two interviews, to ensure that we find the best fit for our team. If you are passionate about technology and creativity and are looking for a rewarding career opportunity, we encourage you to apply today!

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $30.00 - $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 per week

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance

Compensation package:

  • Hourly pay
  • Yearly bonus

Experience level:

  • 1 year
  • 2 years
  • No experience needed

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

  • Blacksburg, VA 24060: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

We are seeking a highly motivated Associate Developer Intern to join our team and assist in evaluating the scalability of our applications, troubleshooting issues, managing logs effectively, and comparing multiple log management tools to propose the best tool for our needs.

This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced environment and contribute to the success of our LIMS (Laboratory Information Management System) solution.

Duration: Internship would span from the beginning of June until the end of August 2024.

Responsibilities: Day-to-day asks are likely to include –
Evaluate the scalability of our applications by analyzing performance metrics and identifying bottlenecks.
Work closely with the development team to implement solutions to improve application performance and scalability.
Manage logs generated by our applications, including aggregation, and analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the smooth operation of our applications. Maintaining technical documentation

Requirements:
Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Good understanding of software development concepts and best practices.
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, or Azure).
Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Java, Python, JavaScript).
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. Ability to work as part of a team.
Good communication skills and eagerness to learn.

Preferred Qualifications:
Previous internship or project experience in software development or related fields. Knowledge of containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes). Experience with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Splunk, Snowflake , or CloudWatch).

Duration: This internship is a 12-week full-time position.

Location: Remote/Hybrid (Westbrook, ME) Must be driving distance from Westbrook, Maine.

Why IDEXX?
We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from diseases. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 10,000 talented people.

So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.

Let’s pursue what matters together.

IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.

IDEXX is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws.

full-desc:
This is a paid internship that is part of Heaven Hill's Summer Internship Program (May-August). The role is an office / hybrid position, with the ideal candidate located in the Greater Louisville area.

What the Role Is

As an Information Technology Intern, you will play a crucial role in managing file servers, ensuring efficient data organization, and facilitating the migration of files to a new location. Your responsibilities will involve working closely with file owners, assessing existing shares, and executing the migration process. This internship provides an excellent opportunity to gain practical experience in IT operations and enhance your technical skills.

As part of the Heaven Hill Summer Internship Program, you will directly support the organizations strategic goals through project work and business-critical assignments. We’re committed to providing valuable experience and professional development opportunities for students in our summer internship program. The summer experience consists of networking, intern development sessions & workshops, tours of Heaven Hill facilities, social events and more!

How You Will Spend Your Time?

  • Share Assessment and Communication:
    • Collaborate with file owners to identify and document existing file shares on the server
    • Communicate effectively with stakeholders to understand their requirements and address any concerns related to file access and permissions
  • File Server Migration:
    • Plan and execute the migration of files from the old server to SharePoint Online
    • Document the migration process and provide training or support to end-users
  • Deprecating the Old Server:
    • Safely remove access to the old file server locations as shares are migrated
    • Decommission the old file server once the migrations are complete
    • Collaborate with the IT team to ensure a smooth transition for users
    • Update documentation and inform relevant parties about the server deprecation
  • Performance Optimization:
    • Troubleshoot any issues related to file services and address them promptly
  • Security and Compliance:
    • Maintain the security of file systems, ensuring data integrity and access control
    • Stay informed about security best practices and implement them as needed
    • Adhere to relevant data protection and privacy regulations
  • Documentation:
    • Maintain detailed documentation of file server configurations, procedures, and policies
  • Create or update documentation for the migration process

Who You Are...

  • Enrolled in a school of technology/engineering with an interest in Enterprise IT
  • Familiarity with Windows environments and SharePoint
  • Basic understanding of networking, Active Directory, and Exchange
  • Organized, detail-oriented and dependable
  • Experience with and/or exposure to infrastructure administration, hardware/software inventory management and incident response procedures desired

Physical Requirements
While performing duties of job, employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands and fingers to handle, or feel objects, and use of computer; reach with hands and arms. Employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.


Heaven Hill and its affiliates are committed to fostering a diverse workforce as an Equal Employment Opportunity company. We invite applications from candidates of all backgrounds, without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, natural origin, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic.

job_title: Intern- Information Technology - Enterprise Architecture & Data
fragmented_desc: ['Provide technical assistance to EA Team with Fact sheet entry and measuring data quality of the fact sheets. Generate custom reports and dashboards using LeanIX…']
full-desc:
We are Subway Headquarters! A dedicated team of professionals supporting thousands of franchisees around the globe.

Region: Shelton, CT USA
Ready for a fresh, new career? Look no further because one of the world’s most iconic brands can help you get there.
Why Join Us?
At Subway, “better” is baked into our DNA. We are a brand that believes in continued improvement … in our lives, our businesses, and our planet. From the handshake that started our very first sandwich shop to earning our position as the world’s leading restaurant brands, we’ve always embraced change and the path ahead. And today, we're making better living way easier.
Our purpose is about more than the food we serve in our restaurants. It’s centered on fueling healthy businesses and healthier lives. It is one of the most exciting times to join the Subway team and contribute to our transformational journey.

About the Role:
We have an exciting internship opportunity to support our Technology team as an Intern - Enterprise Architecture - Reporting based in the USA. The Reporting Intern will collaborate closely with our enterprise architecture team to grow the maturity of our Enterprise Architecture practice. Their primary focus will be on developing the Enterprise Architecture Management (EAM) Application and assisting in the implementation of EA governance policies.
If you feel that this is the role for you, and you are successful with your application, be ready to be Bold, Empowered, Accountable, and ready to have Fun in a fast paced and agile working environment.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Provide technical assistance to EA Team with Fact sheet entry and measuring data quality of the fact sheets.
  • Assist in troubleshooting data quality issues related to LeanIX EAM application.
  • Collaborate with internal technical experts to address team inquiries and concerns.
  • Document EA guidelines, and best practices to ensure consistency and standardization.
  • Generate custom reports and dashboards using LeanIX reporting tools to visualize architecture data.
  • Collaborate with end-users to understand reporting needs and provide insights to support decision-making processes.
  • Coordinate and manage technical proof of concepts (POCs) with other system integrations.
Qualifications:
  • Student must be enrolled at a four (4) year college or university for the duration of the internship.
  • Overall cumulative minimum grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 (on a 4.0 scale) required.
  • Currently pursuing a degree in Process - Information Technology, Security, Business, or relevant experience preferred.
  • Undergraduate students must have completed at least minimum of 75 credit hours (rising Senior).
  • Must be willing to be on site in Shelton during the internship.
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without restriction.
  • Must be 18 years of age.
  • Strong Analytical and Problem-solving skills.
  • Experience in Business Architecture preferred.
  • PowerBI or any other reporting tool experience preferred.
  • Willingness to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
  • Strong verbal and communication skills.
  • Previous customer service/client interface experience, required.
  • Ability to communicate with stakeholder teams and align toward common goals and outcomes.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to successfully juggle multiple initiatives and manage changing priorities.

fragmented_desc: ['Understand clinical study designs and statistical analysis requirements by reading protocols and discussing with the mentors.']
full-desc:
Overview:
The primary responsibilities of this position are to assist with study level statistical related activities, particularly to prepare mock tables/figures/listings, and generate statistical analyses for clinical studies.
Responsibilities:
  • Learn the role of a statistician and statistical analyses by involving in the following activities under the supervising of mentors:
  • Understand clinical study designs and statistical analysis requirements by reading protocols and discussing with the mentors.
  • Review case report forms and understand how clinical data are collected.
  • Understand the components of a statistical analysis plan and assist with the preparation of mock tables, figures, and listings.
  • Review programming specifications and understand the CDISC compliant SDTM and ADaM datasets.
  • Assist with statistical analyses and conduct programming work.
  • Learn to make statistical results interpretation.
  • Learn the sample size and power calculation.
  • Learn the randomization schedule generation
Qualifications:
Education
  • Student currently enrolled in classes leading to an accredited undergraduate or Masters/PhD degree in statistics, biostatistics, mathematics, or science-related fields.
Experience
  • Not required.
Skills
  • Good understanding in statistical concepts and methods
  • Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL.
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills.
Physical
  • Must be able to work in an office environment, which has minimal noise conditions.
  • Ability to stand or sit for most of the work day.
  • Must be able to perform some activities with repetitive motion, such as keyboarding.
This job description does not state or imply that the above are the only duties and responsibilities assigned to this position. Employees holding this position will be required to perform any other job-related duties as requested by Management.

An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

full-desc:
Voted St. Louis Best Places to Work in 2016, 2018, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023!

At Hoffmann Brothers, we stand committed to our mission of Improving Life in Every Home – our customers, our employees, and the communities in which we live and serve. For over 40 years, we have been an industry leader in HVAC, plumbing, electrical, and appliance repair for residential and commercial properties in St. Louis - and now in Nashville, TN! Recipient of multiple Top Workplace and industry awards, we believe in taking the best care of our employees, and they will take the best care of our customers.


2024 Summer Intern: IT Technologies

This paid internship will provide students enrolled in an accredited program the opportunity to work in a real-world, high-tech environment.


The Contributions You’ll Make:

The IT Summer Intern will have the opportunity to work with a variety of systems, from traditional office applications, to networking, web, and other technologies. Candidate will be assigned a project to develop an interoffice IT Support chatbot utilizing ChatGPT. It is a fast-paced environment that affords the right candidate a unique opportunity to be exposed to a variety of technologies and its application to solution business opportunities and challenges.

  • Summer Project: IT Support Chatbot development

  • Network and Infrastructure Services

Preferred Knowledge & Experience:

  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Detail oriented with solid analytical capabilities.
  • Project management & organization

At Hoffmann Brothers, we have identified the following values that are key to success in our culture:

  • People Focused
  • Commitment
  • Ownership
  • Integrity: Honest, Transparent & Trustworthy
  • Solution Driven

full-desc:
About GPA:

GPA has delivered flexible, innovative, and fully integrated solutions using best-of-breed technologies for more than 25 years.

GPA’s automation group specializes in turnkey DCS migration services, automation solutions, control system design, process optimization, process modeling and simulation solutions. Our information technology group provides cybersecurity, BI reporting & analytics, virtualization, statistical process control, network design and more. GPA identifies needs, provides resources and customized solutions that align with unique requirements and discovers hidden opportunities for enhanced efficiency and productivity.

Our vision is to develop meaningful relationships with our employees and customers to achieve best-in-class results through culture, innovation, continuous improvement, and risk management. We have crafted an environment where team members enjoy coming to work every day. A culture of peers that support each other and encourage fresh, innovative ideas.

At GPA Our Mission is to automate, optimize, and secure manufacturing floors everywhere. We use the methodology of "Plan, Build, Run" to dedicate time on the front end of every project to mitigate risk and ensure success on the back end.

Our core values are integrity, continuous improvement, community, customer focus, and teamwork.

GPA offers a safe work environment with a family atmosphere. Our leadership team gives you the tools needed to help grow your career and expand your knowledge. Whether having significant experience or just starting your career, GPA empowers you to grow, challenges you to learn, and encourages innovative ways of thinking. We offer flexible work schedules, remote opportunities and are committed to employee engagement that matters.


Open Intern Positions:


Finance/Business Coordinator:

As a Business Coordinator, you will be responsible for overseeing and managing various business processes within GPA. The role involves handling various aspects of billing, communications and data management. The business coordinator plays a vital role in maintaining the financial and data health of the organization by ensuring accurate and efficient billing processes as well as current customer records.

Responsibilities:

  • Purchase Order Generation:     Prepare and issue purchase orders to vendors based on received quotes and business requirements.
  • Data Entry: Accurately enter purchase orders and billing information into the system, ensuring all details are correct and up-to-date.
  • Vendor & Customer Setup: Coordinate the receipt of required documentation and maintain the database for vendors and customers.
  • Invoice Data Entry: Review invoices for accuracy, completeness, and adherence to company policies before completing data entry.
  • Financial Processes: Record and manage financial data such as sales commissions, forecasting, and other business financial needs.
  • Communication: Correspond with customers to resolve billing inquiries and discrepancies in a professional and timely manner.
  • Record Keeping: Maintain organized records of invoices, payments, and customer interactions.
  • Reporting: Generate and analyze financial reports related to billing activities, forecasting accounts, payable and accounts receivable.
  • Collaboration: Coordinate with other departments, such as sales and operational excellence, to ensure accurate billing information, vendor invoicing and resolve issues.
  • Compliance: Stay updated on billing regulations and compliance requirements to ensure adherence.
  • Assistant – Assist the CEO and CFO with projects as requested.

Skills & Qualifications:

  • Education:     Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or a related field. Relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.
  • Experience: Previous experience in billing, accounting, or financial coordination is preferred.
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve billing issues.
  • Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for effective interaction with customers and internal teams.
  • Attention to Detail: Detail-oriented to ensure accuracy in billing processes and financial records.
  • Software Proficiency: Familiarity with billing software, accounting systems, and the Microsoft Office suite. Advanced Excel knowledge and experience is preferred.
  • Time Management: Ability to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and handle multiple responsibilities.
  • Customer Service: Customer-focused approach with the ability to provide excellent service in resolving billing inquiries.
  • Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
  • Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changes in billing procedures and software.


Operational Technology Intern:


As an OT/IT Intern, you will support and maintain the GPA Help Desk. This includes working with other OT Team Members to establish duties as assigned or with challenges and issues as they arise. You will work under the direction of the Director of Operational Technology Solutions. This role also includes additional support for GPA's networking and IT Professionals. This position will serve as a direct escalation path on day-to-day operations, projects, and will work directly with other OT Team members to implement solutions and complete tasks associated with the support of the GPA systems as well as day-to-day operational duties.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Assist in troubleshooting hardware and software issues for end-users.
  • Provide technical support and guidance to employees on IT/OT-related matters.
  • Assist in the installation, configuration, and maintenance of computer systems and software.
  • Participate in IT/OT projects, including system upgrades and deployments.
  • Help manage and maintain network infrastructure, including switches, and firewalls.
  • Contribute to the development and documentation of IT policies and procedures.
  • Collaborate with team members on special projects and initiatives as needed.
Qualifications:
  • Current enrollment in a bachelor’s degree program in Computer Science or related field.
  • Strong interest in IT/OT and technology.
  • Basic understanding of computer hardware, software, and networking concepts.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft products including Server, Workstation.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
  • Prior internship or relevant work experience is a plus.
Benefits:
  • Hands-on experience in a professional IT/OT environment.
  • Opportunity to work on diverse projects and initiatives.
  • Mentorship from experienced OT professionals.
  • Networking opportunities within the company.
  • Competitive compensation.


Manufacturing Intelligence Intern:

The Manufacturing Intelligence (MI) Solutions Intern position is a learning position for application development and database support. This position will provide learning experience of database and application environments.

The Manufacturing Intelligence (MI) Solutions Intern is responsible for working with MI Specialists and MI
Architects to learn day-to-day operations of database environments including software installation, database
creation, upgrades, patches, problem diagnosis, performance monitoring, maintenance, process automation,
evaluation, and tuning recommendations. They will also contribute to application development in all aspects
of database integration including the deployment of requested database code and configuration changes, as
well as reviewing SQL statements and guiding developers on best practices around how to interact with the
database.

Responsibilities:
  • Learn the day-to-day operations of multiple Microsoft SQL Server databases. Optimize databases for performance and scalability.
  • Responsible for problem resolution, database configuration, capacity planning, performance tuning
and optimizations.
  • Design and implement databases for industrial applications.
  • Provide additional support for MI Solutions Specialist, Architect, Consultant, and above.

Skills & Qualifications:
  • Working understanding of programming languages (Python, C# JavaScript…)
  • Working knowledge of SQL Server technologies (SQL Server clustering, LogShipping, SSRS, etc.)
  • Excellent team player and communicator


Automation Intern

The Automation Intern position is a learning position for development and support. This position will provide learning experience of automation skills and environments. The Automation Intern is responsible for working with Automation Specialists and Architects to learn the daily operations of Automation projects.

Responsibilities:

Basic automation functions

Daily operational duties as assigned

Interact with and assist team members with challenges and issues that arise.


Skills & Qualifications:

Strong verbal communication and problem-solving skills.

Provide additional support to the automation team as needed.


Excellent ability to multi-task.

Strong time management skills.

Strong ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical staff.


Strong desire to learn and grow professionally.

Conduct all activities in a safe and efficient manner.

Excellent troubleshooting skills.

Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.


If you are interested in any of the positions above, please apply to this position and document which Internship you are interested in.

e.g., automotive control systems, smart home devices].

job_title: Co-op Internship, Software Development and BioInformatics (6 Months)
fragmented_desc: ['Assit in design discussions to translate business use cases into technical requirements and helping to design solutions to meet those requirements.']
full-desc:
Overview:

Monte Rosa Therapeutics is seeking passionate Co-op in Software Development and BioInformatics to help us to eliminate disease causing proteins through targeted protein degradation–a novel and exciting way of drugging proteins that until recently were considered un-druggable. The candidates will gain hands-on experience within a particular area of interest in an early-stage drug discovery environment. You will work with an industry leader who will direct and mentor you on your project, as well as expose you to other drug discovery projects and involve you in the process of solving complex biological questions. You will be joining a diverse, thoughtful, fun and collaborative environment that emphasizes teamwork and putting people first!


Responsibilities:

If you have an interest in working on the projects the following areas, we will give you hands on educational experience within a high paced drug discovery environment.


  • Assit in design discussions to translate business use cases into technical requirements and helping to design solutions to meet those requirements
  • Assist in the design, implemention, and deployment of internal software applications. These applications involve both front and backend development, internal and external APIs, data and bioinformatic pipelines, all hosted on cloud infrastructure (AWS).
  • Evolve and enhance our internal search application by developing a natural language interface that leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance query understanding and result accuracy.
    • These enhancements aim to significantly improve the accessability and efficiency of data retrieval allowing users to obtain information through conversational human-like interactions with our application.
  • Facilitate enhanced decision-making and research efficiency by providing quick and accurate answers to intricate questions regarding our compounds and research data.
Qualifications:
  • Our preference is for a student currently in a Master degree program in Data Sciences, BioInformatics, or Computer Science with an interestin a life science
  • Enthusium for exploring the intersection of software and data engineering, data science and life scicnes to develop innovative applications that accelerate the drug discovery process.
  • Experience in one or more general-purpose programming languages (such as Python, Java, Scala, or Go)
  • Eagerness to learn and contribute to software development within a team environment.
  • Openness to acquiring new skills in software design and architecture.
  • Familiarity with coding practices and principles, with a willingness to develop skills in writing clean, maintainable and testable code as well as designing effective APIs.
  • Experience or interest in the design and implementation of high-quality scalable and extendable software architectures.
  • Familiarity or a desire to learn cloud computing services (Experience with AWS serverless technologies (Lambda, SQS, SNS, Amplify, AppSync, DynamoDB, Cloudformation etc )

fragmented_desc: ['We are looking for a Python Developer to join our engineering team and help us develop and maintain various software tools in Python.']
full-desc:
Job Summary:

onsemi Intelligent Sensing Group (ISG) is seeking a Python Developer intern for Fall 2024. We are looking for a Python Developer to join our engineering team and help us develop and maintain various software tools in Python.

Responsibilities:

Python Developer internship responsibilities include writing and testing code, debugging programs and integrating applications with third-party web services.

This opportunity will provide a student the opportunity to enhance experience in the following areas:

  • Recent developments in AI and computer programming in general has led to development of tools such as Tensorflow, Keras, NumPy etc. making it easier to model and draw conclusions from data.
  • In this work we are targeting to re-approach non-linear regression with deep learning enabled by Keras and Tensorflow.
  • In particular, the project will use deep learning to parametrize a non-linear multivariate relationship between inputs and outputs of an industrial sensor with an intent to optimize the sensor

onsemi (Nasdaq: ON) is driving disruptive innovations to help build a better future. With a focus on automotive and industrial end-markets, the company is accelerating change in megatrends such as vehicle electrification and safety, sustainable energy grids, industrial automation, and 5G and cloud infrastructure. With a highly differentiated and innovative product portfolio, onsemi creates intelligent power and sensing technologies that solve the world’s most complex challenges and leads the way in creating a safer, cleaner, and smarter world.


More details about our company benefits can be found here:
https://www.onsemi.com/careers/career-benefits

We are committed to sourcing, attracting, and hiring high-performance innovators, while providing all candidates a positive recruitment experience that builds our brand as a great place to work.


onsemi is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. The Company maintains policies and practices that are designed to prevent discrimination or harassment against any qualified applicant or employee to the extent prohibited by federal, state and local laws and regulations. By way of example, discrimination on the basis of race (actual or perceived), ethnicity, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, citizenship, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law is prohibited.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact Talent.acquisition@onsemi.com for assistance.

Requirements:
In order to be considered for an internship, you must be a student currently enrolled in school pursuing an accredited degree program. This position is specifically looking for an M.Sc. or Ph.D. student in Computer Science or ECE.

Must have requirements:

  • Work experience as a Python Developer
  • Expertise in at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask or Pyramid)
  • Knowledge of object-relational mapping (ORM)
  • Familiarity with front-end technologies (like JavaScript and HTML5)
  • Team spirit
  • Good problem-solving skills

Bonus requirements:

  • Experienced candidates will be considered for developing deep learning algorithms implemented in Python code in order to model the relationship between inputs and outputs of an image sensor.

full-desc:
Who YOU are and what You can become:

Are you looking for a winter semester Information Technology Intern opportunity? Come help us support the risk assessment and assurance actives of our organizations. This 16 week part time opportunity will offers a blend of learning opportunities and hands-on experience, allowing you to gain insights into practical aspects of IT management and support.

Who WE are and where WE are going:

At ST Engineering, we apply our technology and innovation to solve real-world problems and improve lives. Our dedication to excellence and our strong track record have earned us a distinctive reputation for quality and trust as a global technology, defense and engineering group. Our diverse portfolio of businesses spans the aerospace, smart city, defense and public security segments. We are continuing to grow as our expertise and facilities around the world keep aircraft flying safely and transform and future-proof cities to make them more mobile, more secure and more liveable.


What YOU will do:

Participate in troubleshooting to resolve technical problems efficiently.

Help manage user accounts and permissions using tools like Active Directory or similar directory services.

    Assist in tracking hardware and software licenses.

What YOU need:

  • Excellent customer service abilities.

  • Ability to provide training and troubleshooting support.
  • Understanding of LAN and wireless networks.
  • Knowledge of general OS systems, programming languages, and Office software
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.

Hourly pay is $18.00-20.00 per hour dependant on education and experience


It takes diverse talent to solve real-world problems. ST Engineering is deeply committed to building a workplace community where inclusion is valued, and everyone feels welcomed. fragmented_desc: ['Proficiency in data analysis programming languages, particularly R or Python, and a range of data science analysis software. Time Commitment: 24 hours per week.']
full-desc:
Overview:
As we celebrate our Centennial year, we invite you to join us in shaping the next century of impact. Be a relentless force for a world of longer, healthier lives. Here at the American Heart Association, you matter and so does your career.


The American Heart Association’s Internship Program provides college students an opportunity for hands-on experience in various facets for individuals interested in gaining work experience with a non-profit, voluntary health organization.


This internship will focus on supporting the Data Science team and is intended to better your knowledge, understanding, and experience in Data Science and statistical analysis. The individual will be responsible for retrieving, processing, analyzing clinical data, and summarizing results to cross-functional teams. You will have the opportunity to learn and work with staff within Data Science as well as other departments and volunteers.

The Association offers many resources to help you maintain work-life harmonization through your changing needs and life situations. To help you be successful, you will have access to Heart U, our award-winning corporate university, as well as training and support locally and through our National Center.


#TheAHALife is our company culture, our way of life, reflecting our diversity and inclusion, our focus on work-life harmonization, and our Guiding Values. Discover why you will Be Seen. Be Heard. Be Valued™ at the American Heart Association by following us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and at heart.jobs.

Internship Overview:

  • Time Commitment: 24 hours per week
  • Internship Duration: 5/20/2024 – 8/9/2024
  • Remote Position
  • Salary: $23.00 per hour

Internship Outcomes:

Individuals participating in the internship program are provided with an opportunity to:

  • Gain important and practical job skills to be successful in a non-profit environment
  • Opportunity to explore a career path with a reputable voluntary health/service organization.
  • Gain experience in the professional world while learning about board management.
  • Complete an internship that enriches your academic and professional resume as well as enriching your personal life by making a difference in the lives of others.
Responsibilities:

Tasks could include things like the following:

  • Retrieving, processing, and analyzing clinical data or other biomedical data.
  • Developing Data Visualization Tools by designing custom charts and plots to illustrate complex data sets clearly and creating interactive dashboards for data visualization.
  • Summarizing results to cross-functional teams.
  • Draft manuscripts.

Qualifications:
  • Currently pursuing a BA/BS or advanced degree in data science, computer science, statistics, or biomedical engineering.
  • Proficiency in data analysis programming languages, particularly R or Python, and a range of data science analysis software.
  • Experience with large-scale machine learning models and natural language processing techniques, with a focus on Large Language Models (LLMs) such as GPT or similar technologies.
  • Proficient in JavaScript, including libraries and frameworks such as D3.js, Chart.js, or React for developing interactive data visualizations.
  • Experience with front-end web development technologies including HTML5, CSS3, and modern JavaScript ES6+ for creating user interfaces and visualizations.
  • Familiarity with web development frameworks such as Angular, React, or Vue.js for crafting responsive web applications.
  • Knowledge of UI/UX design principles to create intuitive and visually appealing data visualizations.
  • In-depth knowledge of data analysis or statistical analysis methodologies, with prior experience with clinical data being advantageous.
  • Ability to deal professionally in a corporate or non-profit environment and assume responsibility for guiding projects and programs from inception through completion.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment managing multiple priorities involving multiple entities.
  • Intermediate to excellent proficiency in MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.
  • Required Equipment: Reliable WiFi Connection
  • Minimum availability of 20 hrs/wk, M-F between the hours of 8:30am-5pm.
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship, now or in the future. For any roles working remotely, the work must also be performed inside the United States, not in a foreign country.

Compensation & Benefits:

The American Heart Association invests in its people. Visit Rewards & Benefits to see more details.


  • Compensation and Performance     – Attracting talented, committed interns means offering competitive compensation, ongoing professional development and training, and a diverse and inclusive environment in which to work and grow. And we do.
  • Professional Development – You can join one of our many Employee Resource Groups (ERG) or be a mentor/mentee in our professional mentoring program. HeartU is the Association’s national online university, with more than 100,000 resources designed to meet your needs and busy schedule.

:
This position is expected to close April 4, 2024

Apply Today:

Alys Beach is a master-planned 158-acre beach community in active development that includes luxurious private dining, recreation and retail amenities and experiences, vacation rentals and several signature annual events. Alys Beach offers an industry leading compensation plan, medical/dental/vision benefit plans beginning on day one; including life insurance and other ancillary benefits, profit sharing and employee perks.

As an IT Intern at Alys Beach, you will be responsible for providing technical support to our staff and participating in various IT projects. You will work closely with our experienced IT professionals, gaining exposure to a wide range of technologies and systems.

fragmented_desc: ['Our impact covers the whole product lifecycle - from predicting potential problems in new products to understanding the field performance of equipment out in…']
full-desc:
About us:
One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.
What you'll do:
The reliability team in Arizona supports our satellite program which keeps millions of people connected across the globe whether on land, air or sea and also assists in the design and development of RF hardware to support various government programs. As a part of our team, you will learn to calculate the mean time between failures of products and integrate reliability into each step of a product lifecycle. You will gain experience operating a CT, CMMs and other equipment in the Failure Analysis lab.

With software being a critical component of Viasat equipment, software reliability is a field that is growing in importance. You will work with software engineers to develop software failure modes and effects analyses to identify and address potential reliability issues before they become problems.

Reliability is at the center of product improvement. Your work as a reliability intern will help drive business decisions, increase customer satisfaction, and increase product quality. Our impact covers the whole product lifecycle - from predicting potential problems in new products to understanding the field performance of equipment out in the field.
The day-to-day:
  • Capture radiographs and CT images, check CAD design against real world samples
  • Collaborate with internal customers to develop software failure modes and effects analysis
  • Develop reliability predictions to help guide teams on design decisions
  • Support other reliability engineers on various projects and tasks
What you'll need:
  • Currently pursuing Bachelor's degree or higher in Reliability Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and Office suite
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • A willingness to drive improvements and get to the root cause of a problem
  • Ability to work well with a wide variety of people and teams
  • Ability to commit to a 10-12 week summer internship
  • US Citizenship required
What will help you on the job:
  • Basic understanding of failure modes and effects analysis
  • Prior experience or knowledge in reliability and quality engineering
Salary range: $21 - $66 / hourly : At Viasat, we consider many factors when it comes to compensation, including the scope of the position as well as your background and experience. Base pay may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Additional cash or stock incentives may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. Learn more about Viasat’s comprehensive benefit offerings that are focused on your holistic health and wellness at careers.viasat.com/LifeAtViasat/Benefits. EEO statement:
Viasat is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, genetics, age, or veteran status or any other applicable legally protected status or characteristic. If you would like to request an accommodation on the basis of disability for completing this on-line application, please click here.

Pay,Benefits, & Work Schedule


Internship available with the Office of the City Manager located at 414 East 12th Street
Salary Range: $18.00/hour
Normal Work Days/Hours: Varies between Monday-Friday, 8:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m.
Application Deadline Date: April 08, 2024

Qualifications


REQUIRES high school diploma or GED and enrollment in an accredited college, university, or trade school.

Qualifications


The City of Kansas City is seeking driven and passionate innovators to join our internship program. This is an opportunity to be part of a dynamic team exploring the intersection of sustainability, data analytics, and strategic communications.

You will have the opportunity to make a tangible impact in the City while honing your skills in innovation, sustainability, data analytics, and strategic communications. This internship offers a unique platform to contribute to meaningful projects that address real-world challenges and pave the way for a more sustainable Kansas City. If you are ready to embrace this exciting journey of innovation and community impact, apply at the link below.

Key focus areas:

  • Sustainability
    Development and scale up the City's composting and other sustainability efforts.
  • Data Science and Analytics
    Collaborate with the data team to gather, analyze, and interpret relevant data to enable better informed and data-driven decision-making.
  • Strategic Communications
    Work with the communications team to craft and develop compelling content to showcase the City's sustainability initiatives.

Other Information


URGENT!!! CRITICAL RECRUITMENT INFORMATION

Applications and/or resumes are evaluated on the information received by the application deadline. Please ensure that your application or resume clearly demonstrates how you meet the minimum qualifications for the position for which you are applying, this includes providing all relevant educational dates and a detailed description of relevant work experience, including months/years of employment. Applications and/or resumes may not be considered if information is incomplete.

In order for a resume to be used in lieu of an application the resume must have been submitted online via the City’s Applicant Tracking System.

Positions requiring a high school diploma/GED certificate must be obtained from a school/program accredited by the Department of Education and recognized by the U.S. Secretary of Education.

The minimum education requirement for positions that allow for experience equivalency for an accredited degree is a high school diploma. Unless otherwise specified, an accredited degree must be obtained from a college or university listed with the U.S. Department of Education and recognized by the U.S. Secretary of Education.

For positions with a salary grade of EX6 or higher that require an accredited degree, qualifying professional experience must be obtained AFTER the accredited degree is obtained.

Successful completion of a pre-employment criminal history/background check is required for all positions. Some positions require a post offer drug screen and/or physical.

If appointed, non-residents must obtain residency inside Kansas City, Missouri's city limits within nine months.

The City of KCMO is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion in the workplace. The City is committed to providing a workplace environment for its employees and citizens free from discrimination based on race, color, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, religion, age, disability, marital status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or gender identity. For more information, please see our EEO Policy

The City of KCMO is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please call 816-513-1908 or send an e-mail to accommodations@kcmo.org.

If claiming military veterans' preference points, you must attach a copy of your DD-214 or a DD-256 (for reservists). To claim veterans’ points you must have served 180 days of regular active duty service and be discharged or released under honorable conditions during peacetimes or 90 days of active duty service, one (1) day during “wartime” and a last discharge or release under honorable conditions. (DOD) 38 U.S. Code § 4211).

full-desc:
Landis+Gyr is a leading global provider of integrated energy management solutions. We measure and analyze energy utilization to generate empowering analytics for smart grid and infrastructure management, enabling utilities and consumers to reduce energy consumption. Our innovative and proven portfolio of software, services and intelligent sensor technology is a key driver to decarbonize the grid. Having avoided more than 9 million tons of CO2 in FY 2021 and committed to achieve carbon neutrality by 2030, Landis+Gyr manages energy better – since 1896.
With sales of USD 1.5 billion in FY 2021, Landis+Gyr employs around 6,500 talented people across five continents.


Welcome to Landis+Gyr! We're at the forefront of the energy industry revolution - let's build a brighter energy future together!

Landis+Gyr is seeking an undergraduate Intern for Summer 2024 working on-site Monday through Friday at our Alpharetta, GA office. This is a paid position but we don't offer a housing stipend or relocation assistance so local candidates are preferred.


Project Overview/Job Description
Interesting opportunity for Software Development enthusiasts with an added bonus to get an introduction into the energy domain. The project will involve working on real world software projects, fixing code quality issues by enhancing and adding new unit tests to existing code in a Microsoft Stack environment.

In addition to learning software development and quality fundamentals, the intern will also have an opportunity to learn multiple technologies, including C#, Visual Studio, SQL, Oracle, REST APIs, Kafka, Microservices, MS Azure DevOps, Angular, Java.

To demonstrate the skills learned, the interns will be able to demonstrate quality improvements they implemented using Code Coverage reports, SonarQube reports, and defects fixed using MS Azure DevOps dashboards.


Student Objectives/Responsibilities:
  • Fixing and enhancing code unit tests under guidance of an experienced Senior Software Engineer


  • Working with hardware and testing software.


  • Monitoring the Jenkins builds and analyzing unit tests failures.


  • Analyzing SonarQube reports and creating defects in ADO for fixing issues reported by the tools.


  • Upgrading existing NuGet package tests to .Net Core


  • Updating MS Azure DevOps defects fixed as part of the project.

Qualifications Sought:
  • Interest in Software development


  • Self-motivated to learn new technology. Should be comfortable with C# and .NET.


  • Enthusiastic about online research and problem solving.


Education: An undergraduate student who has completed their Freshman year or higher seeking their Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.


If you have the drive and enthusiasm to accept this challenge and to work in a very dynamic, cross functional and international environment, we are looking forward to meeting you.

Location: Alpharetta, GA, US
Workplace Type: On-site
Career Level: Intern
Date Posted: Mar 6, 2024


Nearest Major Market: Alpharetta
Nearest Secondary Market: Atlanta

Overview

The Data Analyst Intern will assist the Development Analyst with creating GIS maps for the development team to use to find competitive real estate to develop affordable housing across Woda Cooper’s entire portfolio. The Data Analyst Intern will need experience or familiarity with Excel, Python, HTML, CSS, and/or JavaScript, and maintain a thorough knowledge of state QAPs, scoring criteria, and other government regulations and guidelines.

Why Woda Cooper?

Founded in 1990, Woda Cooper is a prominent leader in affordable housing development, construction, and management. We are a proud employee-owned company with a development portfolio worth $1.5 Billion, with over 350 properties and 16,000 units across 16 states. Our commitment to high-quality, affordable housing has earned us a top rank among developers and owners nationwide. Be a part of a team that's building more than homes - we're building futures!

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Analyze affordable housing documents from various municipalities, states, and other public and private sources.
  • Gathering data from publicly available sources and scraping data.
  • Creating usable maps with MapBox software including adding new features and design.
  • Other tasks as assigned.

Required Skills and Abilities:

  • Familiarity with Excel, Python, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Detail oriented with strong time management and critical-thinking skills.

full-desc:
Software Development Summer Internship

Are you interested in hands-on software development?

Overview

We offer summer internship positions where you will be trained on full stack software development.

This is a mentorship program we are passionate about. Our top technical staff gathers together each year to design a fresh program that evolves with our technology needs. We focus on making sure you develop a strong foundation of knowledge to build your career on.

The two key areas of focus are:

  • Technical skills related to designing and building software.
  • Agile methodologies that enable teams to work effectively.

You'll get to meet other developers in the company, build products, and participate in team building activities. Software development is not just about delivering code, it is about creating a team and culture that can build great software.


Responsibilities

  • Learn and work with a variety of technologies related to full stack development.
  • Participate in an Agile team environment to complete one or more web-based projects.


Prerequisites

  • Strong grasp of basic Java programming (2-3 years of coding in school and other venues).
  • Creative ability to solve problems, especially logic problems.
  • A genuine interest in software development.

Highly desired is software development work outside of school such as internships, personal projects, and hackathons.


About SimonComputing, Inc.

SimonComputing is dedicated to simplifying the process of building software. We specialize in developing technically challenging applications and serve clients in the public and private sectors.

SimonComputing, Inc. is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.
